name: Place to stay in Bozeman · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Yellow Dogs Cottage is a Stylish and uniquely charming cottage is walking distance to Montana State University and town, close to skiing at Bridger Bowl & Big Sky, fishing, hiking, and so much more. Nestled in a lush, historic South-side neighborhood this cottage is thoughtfully and lovingly renovated and decorated. The cottage is always cleaned & sanitized between guests.

The space
We think that you will truly enjoy the unique style of Yellow Dog Cottage, nestled in a lush historic South-side neighborhood, lovingly renovated and decorated with contemporary Knoll furniture pieces paired with antiques and rustic accents. Quality linens & bathrobes. Our 110-year-old farmhouse-style home is on the other side of this property providing privacy, but making it convenient to get anything extra you might need.

Why not pay less than you might for most standard hotel rooms and enjoy loads of space, high standard furnishings, and extras like fresh coffee beans a
neighborhood_overview: We think our neighborhood is the nicest in Bozeman. Here is where you will find most of the town's historic homes, including the Story Mansion just one block away. There is a wonderful, friendly atmosphere with a mix of locals, transplant families, and university students who all live in Bozeman for the amazing quality of life and accessibility to the incredible array of outdoor activities and beauty. MSU and downtown are each less than 10 minutes by foot. Hiking and biking trails are close by.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.85 · 3 bedrooms · 8 beds · 2 baths
description:
Beautiful condo in Bozeman Montana, close to skiing, fly fishing, Montana State, Yellowstone, and the many other attractions found in and around scenic Bozeman. Voted one of outdoor magazines best towns in the country and powder magazines best ski town in the country. Why stay in a hotel when you can have a whole condo with all the amenities. *A $100 Fee will be charged for pets in addition to normal pricing.

City of Bozeman STR#-STR23-00011

The space
The condo is spacious with plenty of room for everyone to enjoy and relax. A gas fireplace in the winter is perfect for warming your bones after a long ski day at Bridger or Big Sky. The furniture in the living room is all brand new including a new pullout couch to add even more sleeping space if need be. Washer and dryer in their own laundry room with two full baths, a bunk room, a guest room, and a master.

Guest access
Guests will have the entire condo to themselves.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Explore the quaint town of Bozeman when you stay at this well-appointed 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental townhome! This mid-century modern getaway offers all the comforts of home, incredibly fast internet connection, contemporary furnishings, and accommodations for 4. With its historic architecture packing tons of old time charm, an amazing location in the residential Bon Ton District, and several outdoor activities within minutes, this townhome is the ideal Montana retreat!

The space
Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed

Step into the open interior of this inviting townhome to find sleek hardwood floors and high ceilings. The living room is the ideal place to kick back and relax, as it boasts 2 plush couches, a stylish armchair, and flat-screen cable TV.

Flowing seamlessly into the living area is the dining room outfitted with a trendy 4-person table and cabinet filled with dishware. You'll love the vintage feel of the adorable
neighborhood_overview:
The city of Bozeman is scattered with various hidden gems, such as the American Computer Museum or Emerson Cultural Center. More well known is the Museum of the Rockies that has a research center, planetarium shows, and extensive collection of dinosaur fossils from around the world!

To explore downtown, take a leisurely 1-mile walk to North Wilson Avenue and find a variety of shops and restaurants! Coffee aficionados will love being close to so many brew houses, including The Nova Cafe, Zocalo Coffee House, and Wild Joe*s Coffee Spot.

No matter the time of year, there's always an outdoor activity to enjoy nearby, from hiking at Yellowstone National Park to skiing at Bridger Bowl when the snow falls. In the summertime, be sure to check out the serene beauty of Palisade Falls, the Gallatin River, and Grotto Falls Trail! Only 3 blocks away is The Gallagator Trail, also known as the Linear Trail, that extends from the mountains to downtown!

Close to the h

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

name: Loft in Bozeman · ★4.91 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Cozy penthouse filled with natural light, modern design, and incredible views. Enjoy morning coffee while watching Hawks, Sandhill Cranes, and Whitetail Deer forage in the wetland with views of Story Hill and the Bridger Mountain Range all from your deck. 10-minute drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort and 2-minute walk to Lindley Park with biking/hiking/groomed XC ski trails. Stroll down Main Street, downtown Bozeman has countless eateries and breweries or eat-in, you have a fully equipped kitchen.

The space
Cozy space on the third floor of a newly constructed apartment. Repurposed wood floors, solar heating, new furniture, and new appliances. Main Street location yet the loft overlooks the adjacent wetland area and the Bridger Range. Enjoy the electric fireplace on chilly nights and AC for hot summer nights. The loft has a private deck with furniture and guests have access to the gas grill and covered eating area in the entry courtyard. Contact the host for addit

neighborhood_overview: One block from Historic Main Street, Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. host_about:
Hi there! My name is Cooper and I grew up in the lowcountry of South Carolina. I developed a love for the outdoors at a very young age and enjoy hiking, mountain biking, and anything on the water. 

I work remote for a software company you have probably used before and love the flexibility it gives me in terms of work locations / home offices. I have been to 32+ countries and want to keep adding to my list. What is your favorite country? 

When I travel I prefer to stay for longer visits to spread my roots into the local communities. 28+ day stays are my speciality so all of my units are equipped for mid term stays. Think standup desks, fast wifi, everything you need to cook, and welcoming spaces.

Making sure you have a smooth check in and the ability to ask any questions during your stay is my #1 priority.

description:
Here is the antidote to the Bozeman hotel conundrum: a peaceful, urban retreat.

Enjoy a stocked kitchen, outdoor grill, W/D, dishwasher, and large dining table. Relax on the sleeper sofa with Netflix, or on the patio.

Upstairs we have two large bedrooms with desks and a newly remodeled bathroom.

Convenient access to MSU, downtown, Bogert Park, Farmer's Market, Pete's Hill, Library. Use our bikes and kayaks at your leisure. Bridger Bowl is a 20 minute drive and Big Sky is one hour away.

The space
When you enter, the living room is straight ahead with the kitchen to your left. Past the kitchen is the laundry room and a half bath. In the living room, the sleeper sofa pulls out with sheets available in the upstairs linen closet. Off the living room is a deck. Upstairs, there are two bedrooms and a full bath.

Newly renovated home that was originally built in 1941. This historic home was previously owned by the Governor of Montana. name: Home in Bozeman · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
description:
Fantastic house and yard, 3 blocks from Main Street at the end of the street and right along Bozeman Creek. New for 2023! High speed wifi. A/C

The space
Note: the new owner's addition off the back of the house is still under construction so the house is discounted for the first few months of operation as there will usually be some noise and activity.

Location, Location, Location!! Bozeman Creek House is a creekside oasis that is ideally situated only 3 blocks from historic downtown Bozeman. This lovely home was moved to its current location from North 7th Avenue in the early 9o’s. For many years the home had no connection to the creek and very little exposure to the outdoors. Jacquie Love purchased the home in 2010 and sought to fix that with a remodel that added many windows towards the creek, a side porch and front deck, numerous modern amenities, and extensive gardens.

Bogert Park, one of Bozeman’s nicest parks, is connected to miles of
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Our bright and open Mother-in-Law unit is newly remodeled and in a great location in Bozeman. You can walk or bike to downtown, MSU, neighborhood parks, trails, coffee shops and restaurants. Easy drive to Yellowstone Park and much more to explore.

The space
This is a great place to stay if you are visiting MSU for events or visiting your college student. The two full size beds can accommodate up to 2 couples.
We are only 2 blocks from campus. Grab a cup of coffee at one of the 2 local coffee shops on the way.
I have plenty of kiddie gear if you are a young family including pack-n-play, toddler cot, booster chairs, high chair and kiddie plates/bowls/utensils and toys. Just ask and I will be happy to stock it for you before you arrive.
For international guests, I have outlet converters in the unit.

Guest access
The cottage has off street parking and a shared back yard that you are welcome to enjoy. Any of the toys you see are w
neighborhood_overview: At the cottage you are a few blocks from MSU campus, Joe's Parkway Grocery, Pickle Barrel sandwiches AND Ice Cream shop, 2 coffee shops, and the AWESOME Columbo Pizza place. Neighborhood parks - Cooper Park and Southside Park- are also a few blocks away.
host_about:
I am a mother of 2 who enjoys to cook and play outside. I love my neighborhood and would not want to live anywhere else in Bozeman- and trust me I have looked but this is the place for me! 
Both my husband and I are from the East coast and travel back as often as possible. 
I love the warm season here and my husband loves the cold-you will get plenty of input from us if you need suggestions on what to do.

name: Hostel in Bozeman · ★4.61 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 2 shared baths
description:
We are a safe, clean and affordable hostel located in downtown Bozeman close to all the popular bars, restaurants and hotspots. We are located extremely close to the free Streamline and Skyline bus pick-ups, making transportation to other areas easy. This rate is per person in the room.

The space
We are a basement hostel located in downtown Bozeman. Our common rooms (library and front TV room) have windows with natural light, but our individual rooms do not have windows.

Other things to note
Bathrooms are SHARED, dorm-style so each room does not have a bathroom in it and the facilities are shared by the entire hostel. There is a women's bathroom and a men's bathroom (with a couple showers and toilets in the restroom).

description:
My place is close (7 minutes) to nightlife, the airport, parks, and the city center. It is 15 minutes to skiing at Bridger Bowl. You’ll love my place because of the kitchen, the coziness, the high ceilings, the views, and the location. The location is extremely private at the end of the road yet 5 minutes to town. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. The loft area has mountain views out all windows. Custom mattresses, assortment of pillows.

The space
This A-frame was originally built in 1968 and has been completely gutted, re-wired, re-plumbed, re-framed...it is 95% new construction. This property is truly a labor of love and I am continually changing things and improving things to make it the most comfortable and aesthetically pleasing airbnb in the area. When I travel it is really important to me to have comfortable beds and pillows and so I spared no expense with the mattresses and offer a large variety of pillows so that you
neighborhood_overview: To get downtown you really only need to take 2 turns.  I think this location offers you the best of what Bozeman has to offer.
host_about:
I am a Washington State Native with a degree in Economics from University of San Diego. I am a licensed Realtor with Knoff Group Real Estate and I love searching for the perfect property for buyers.  I like to hike, bike, ski and adventure.  Please let me know if you need help finding real estate in one of the last best places. 

I want to make your stay as pleasant as possible so let me know if you need anything.

Ideally located three blocks from historic main street, this beautiful newer condo has views of the Bridger Mountains from the upper wrap around deck and is spacious and modern inside. Garage parking included.

The space
When you walk in the front door, the tall ceilings, large windows, and concrete floors set the tone of a new modern home. The main floor is open with two doors to the outside. The dining room table and extra chairs can expand to accommodate a large family gathering. The living room has a comfortable leather corner couch and comfortable sitting chair for relaxing and visiting, playing games or watching movies. There is a large tv with full cable service as well as state of the art Roku streaming options - bring your Netflix password and enjoy!

The kitchen has new composite countertops and all the amenities from home. Prepare meals with ease as it comes fully equipped with new appliances.

neighborhood_overview: This a about as close to downtown as you can get and still be in a residential area. It's amazingly quiet and there is a large park just a block away.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★3.44 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
The space
Hunters Way

Welcome to your home away from home in Bozeman, tucked into a quiet neighborhood between Gallatin County Regional Park and West Winds Park, both offering lots of walking trails that you and your dog will love! All the shops, bars, and restaurants of downtown Bozeman are around three miles away, and you’re absolutely surrounded by opportunities for year-round outdoor recreation.

At home, you’ll find a cozy space, with warm hardwood floors and plenty of room to spread out. Put your chef’s hat on and become the star of the vacation with favorite recipes prepared in the full, well-equipped kitchen. Spend the day exploring, then kick back on the comfortable couch and watch a movie while you refresh the day’s clothes in the convenient washer/dryer. Step out for dinner at one of Bozeman’s many world-class restaurants, then call it a night in any of the well-appointed bedrooms. Hunters Way will leave you with unforgettable vacation memo
host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.79 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Located in a quiet neighborhood only 3 blocks from Historic Downtown Bozeman, this town house encompasses the front portion of the main house. This is a very unique property with limestone constructed private living quarters (owner occupied) on the backside of the main house which is attached to the living space above the garage. There is also a separate Airbnb apartment (no kitchen) upstairs with its own private entrance, called the RedChair Retreat. These spaces are separate and private.

The space
This is an open and comfortable space that occupies the original part of the home. The front bedroom has a stonewall fireplace (nonworking), an armoir and french doors with curtains. There's a fully stocked kitchen with a small dining counter with 2 stools. The living/dining room area has a large leather couch for reading or watching TV, plus a dining room table that seats up to 6 people. The back bedroom has built in cupboards and drawers and is the most pr
neighborhood_overview: Considering we're only a few blocks from downtown, we have a nice, quiet and predominately family neighborhood.  However, you're only a 5 minute walk from tons of restaurants, shops and nightlife.
host_about: I have been a resident of Bozeman for 40 years and former Director of Marketing and Reservations at Bridger Bowl for 28 years.  I'm also an avid Nordic skier, cyclist, fly fisherman, traveler and a musician. I've cuurently combined interest in Latin percussion and travels to Cuba to do a cross-cultural music project with musicians from Santiago de Cuba and Bozeman.  I've also served on Yellowstone Country of Montana regional tourism board for many years and know the area very well.  I love food ...and I know where to find the good stuff!

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
This cozy "Lagom" loft is well appointed stay. A short walk to downtown Bozeman & MSU. Enjoy the local foodie & shopping scenes. Venture to Yellowstone National Park. Enjoy unforgettable Montana experiences hiking & biking in the mountains or fishing in the rivers. Hit the local world class Big Sky Ski Resort or Bridger Bowl, & soak in local Hot Springs. Retire in luxury & comfort while watching the sun peak over the Mountains from your private balcony. (City Hosting Permit Number #STR20-00391)

The space
"Lagom" is a Swedish term which means "just the right amount." "1" means balance & unity. We have a balanced blend of comfort & amenities. Our colors & textures exude the natural landscape with rich & warm greens, blues, yellows, & cream tones. Enjoy books about Western History & Natural Adventures. We have western films & feel good movies to select from. Games which families of all ages may play while seated around the living room coffee table. Hot cocoa, tea, &
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the quieter side of downtown "South-Side" Bozeman, Montana. Nestled in the "Gallatin Valley" surrounded by 7 Mountain ranges! During your stay at the "Cozy Lagom1 SOBO Loft," you will be located in a beautiful & walkable historically established neighborhood with mature trees. Montana State University is right up the road. Take a walk through "MSU" campus to "The Museum of the Rockies" where you may explore early history in the Rocky Mountain Western regions, dinosaur bones, fossils, special exhibits & planetarium shows. "Emerson Cultural Center, Rialto, Elm, & The Willson Auditorium" for performance/concert venues are all short walkable distances away. If you enjoy breezing through the city there are scooters strewn across the town during summer months. Walking distances to parks, playgrounds, & trails. Montana mornings & evenings tend to be on the cooler side no matter what time of year so don't forget to bring clothing options.

In the winter the fun is just beginnin
host_about:
We are Abigail & Eric! We are excited to have you stay! Born & raised Montanans, designer & builder come together to create a beautiful Montana experience just for you.  We are excited to help you navigate Montana & can send a guide on what to bring based on what adventures you plan on having. We have recommendations galore! Want to go skiing, hiking, have day trips, or enjoy fishing? Go out & have an incredible meal, enjoy local walks, & events? We are happy to assist. Montana is truly "Big Sky" country & has the ability to take your breath away. These trips are memories which last. 

Our family enjoys an array of outdoor adventures & love traveling to experience local moments wherever we go. We ski, snowboard, ice-skate, sled, hike, & dip into hot springs. On our hikes we love waterfalls & enjoy sitting around a fire in the mountains sipping on honey tea. Life is a sensory experience & we are thrilled to share these beautiful places we enjoy immensely with you.

Charming townhouse with 3 bedrooms and 2.5 baths in Beautiful Bozeman. Overlooks walking path and pond in a quiet neighborhood. Conveniently located less than a mile from Shopping, fuel and Restaurants. Less than 10 minute drive to Bobcat Stadium, 30 minutes to Bridger Bowl and 15 minutes to BZN Airport with easy access to I-90! Quick trip for fishing, hot springs, camping and Big Sky Ski Resort. The space
NEWLY added Central Air conditioning!!!All bedrooms are located upstairs on the second floor. name: Boutique hotel in Bozeman · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
description:
The RSVP experience is unlike anything you will find in Montana — a place where Stetsons and whiskey pair well with sun hats and a little bubbly. A vibrant reimagining of an old-school hotel, the RSVP’s interiors are awash with a trendy boutique flair that draws inspiration from the property’s Big Sky environs. host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and bars! Quiet, yet centrally located. If you're planning on staying in town there is no need to rent a car.
host_about:
We have been traveling with Airbnb for the past 6 years and have been hosts ourselves for the past 4. We love the experience of staying in a home and getting familiar with a neighborhood when we travel and we are happy to pass that experience along to our guests. 
We reside in Livingston, Montana where we spend our free time floating the rivers, fishing and camping in the summers and skiing at nearby Bridger Bowl in the winter. 
We prefer our privacy and independence when we travel but are always open to local tips and suggestions and we are happy to give you the same when you come to Montana.
We are both local business owners who have a combined 30+ years in the area. We are more than happy to share any knowledge of the area that we have with you. Please ask!

name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Our fun & sun-filled loft has a private entrance & a newly remodeled kitchen, a bathroom with shower/tub, a queen & a twin bed, and a small sofabed. There is a BBQ & an outdoor dining table + an indoor swing. Just blocks from the university & historic downtown.

We have a Bozeman city short term rental license (BCA-11644) so we are all set there too!

The space
We like to think of our home as very comfortable and fun. There is a red wooden swing in the middle of the loft, lots of Montana guide books, bikes to borrow plus cozy "Lawson's Loft" terry cloth robes to relax in while visiting.

The loft is stocked with spices and kitchen utensils, pots and pans, plus you have access to an outdoor grill. We have bikes you may use too - they are located in the shed in the alley right near the big gate you enter.

We have been hosting guests in the Loft for many years now, and have had nothing but wonderful visitors and good experiences. Eve
neighborhood_overview: The Southside of Bozeman is the main historic district. It is composed of safe, and friendly neighborhoods lined with mature trees, and an eclectic array of architecture. From our home, it is only a few minute walk to MSU, a short bike ride or walk to the historic downtown. And just two blocks from our home is Bozeman's Southside Park, with a play ground for kids, plus tennis/pickle ball courts, and in the winter,  an ice skating rink.
host_about:
We found our home with a promise of rhubarb pies . . . 

Here is the back story to that rather strange sounding statement. My husband is from Alaska but went to dental school in San Francisco, where we met. He knew he had to get back to the mountains - so we spent the late 1990's searching for our "forever" college/mountain town. Our first visit to Bozeman and we knew it would be our future community - but the search for the "forever" home proved more difficult. 

Eventually, we placed notes on the doors of our favorite Bozeman homes, promising 20 years of rhubarb pies to anyone who led us to our forever home. Jane, the sweet grandmother who owned this 1920's  former sorority house responded, saying she had a rhubarb plant in the backyard and wanted to sell to a young family who would take good care of the place - and the rest is history. 

The summer of 2020 we will deliver our 20th rhubarb pie to Jane! 

Here are a few other details you might want to know about your potential host (Website hidden by Airbnb) taught culture related courses (e.g. "The Cultural Dimensions of International Business" & "Film, Photos & Culture: A Global Perspective") at Montana State University for about 15 years until I retired in 2020. My husband, Scott, daughter, Sumner and I were part-time ski instructors at Big Sky in the past, but now just ski for fun.

Scott is an avid bike rider, and even completed the 2,500+ mile "Great Divide Mountain Bike Ride" in the fall of 2016. Which means he rode from Banff, Canada to Mexico, on a mountain bike. He did it over a series of week-long segments - camping out along the way. When he is not riding he works doing dentistry here in Bozeman. 

Sumner studied "Global Health & Education" at Colorado College, and graduated in 2018. She nordic and Alpine skis, runs and climbs and is now in medical school at the University of Washington. 

Sumner's pup, Magnolia is a Bernedoodle. She is very friendly - but a bit shy at first.  She might bark - and also wag her tail - the 1st time she see's you but once you've been introduced she warms up quickly.

We are looking forward to hosting you, and hope you have a great experience here in Bozeman!

neighborhood_overview: This is a very family friendly neighborhood with walking trails throughout. Harvest Creek  is  known for it's convenient location,  pristine  houses,  manicured lawns, trees & walking trails.
host_about: My husband and I are an active retired couple that enjoy traveling & doing primarily "staycations".  We  decided two years into retirement instead of staying in (Hidden by Airbnb) ’s to turn houses we purchased in Bozeman, Montana (our favorite place)  and Columbia , Missouri into (Hidden by Airbnb) ’s.  We love the lifestyle of living close to our families who are in different states and then renting our houses to people that need short term rentals.  We set our houses up with our guests in mind which simplifies and streamlines our living as well. We have met absolutely wonderful people along this 10 year journey and love the lifestyle. We enjoy hiking, biking, kayaking, fishing, watercolor and most of all hanging out with family.  We try to live by the motto  "treat others as you would have them treat you" and generally all else falls in place.

Whether you are an outdoor enthusiast, enjoy strolling the historic street of downtown Bozeman or visiting the Gallatin Valley on business - this is your home away from home. You will be within walking distance to the thriving downtown area with many restaurants, coffee shops, salons, boutiques, cultural venues, Montana State University,and the world famous Museum of the Rockies. There are miles of hiking, biking, and cross country trails located just blocks away. Recreation begins with the breathtaking views of the Bridger Mountains and Hyalite Recreation Area that are displayed out of the dinning and living room windows. Burke Park, 40 acres of non fenced beauty where endless miles of trails weave through, is right around the corner. This area features Peet's Hill which is a great place to close the day out watching the sunset with views of Bozeman. Single track trails continue across Highland Blvd and follow Kagy Road to ‘Painted Hills Trail’.

neighborhood_overview: The main house was built in 1880 and remodeled extensively in 2003.  Your suite was new construction in 2003.  Originally the site of one of Bozeman's blacksmith shops, the property is in the historic district just one block from Main street.  The location offers a perfect balance of proximity and privacy.  Just far enough off of Main for tranquility but only a minute or two walk to the heart of Downtown.  Go for breakfast at family oriented Overeasy or the hip Nova Cafe.  Or show up early for biscuits and gravy at the Western Cafe where ranchers, bankers and everyone in between have met over coffee for generations.
host_about:
In our 70's, my wife Linda are retired from 45 year-long careers in outdoor pursuits and adventure travel.  From 1975 to 2015 we pioneered educational and adventure travel to Baja California (whale watching, sea kayaking, natural history)  China, Tibet, Argentina, Mongolia, and Uruguay on horseback.    

We pay our cleaners more than $30 per hour.

The second bathroom is also a full bath and has a washer and dryer. The second bedroom has a full bed and a modular desk. The photos show just one module set up, but a second module can be added if you prefer more desk space.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is a half mile off of Main Street, and all the shops and restaurants! About 500 feet from the apartment are the trail-heads for the Gallagator Linear Trail and Peete's Hill.  Just past the trail-head (as you walk towards Main Street) is Bogert Park, where the Farmer's Market is held during the summer.  A few blocks away is the Bozeman Library, and Lindley Park (the site for the Sweet Pea Festival in August).
host_about: I've lived in Bozeman, MT since 2001. I love to be able to share what I love about the area with guests!

name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Fantastic neighborhood 1/2 a block from a 5-acre park, trail system, and trout stocked lake. This unit has no shared walls, high ceilings, an open-concept living space, private bedroom and bathroom. Located on the Streamline bus route it is minutes from Bozeman's unique shopping and gourmet dining.

The space
The space is located over a detached two car garage. The ceilings are vaulted which creates an open and airy feeling. The unit has an open concept living and kitchen area, with the separate bedroom and bathroom offering privacy.

Guest access
This unit offers its own off-street parking pad. Because it is a small part of a larger property, and because the majority of the property is leased with the main house, this unit does not have access to the yard. However, there are seven miles of walking trails throughout the neighborhood and contiguous surrounding area. The unit is proximate to a gorgeous 5-acre park with a large pond (catch
neighborhood_overview: This lovely, established neighborhood has quick access to over 7 miles of walking trails.  A  block away lies a 5 acre park which offers a multitude of activities.  Walk or run the trail that circles the large pond stocked with blue ribbon trout (catch and release fishing allowed).  Enjoy a picnic in the shelter at the pond, complete with BBQ grills.  Set the kids loose in the popular playground and gather the friends and family for a sand volleyball match.  The Gallatin Valley 100 acre park is less than a mile away and the unit is minutes from downtown.  Keep the car parked and walk or bike to The Market, Bozeman's new hub of dining and shopping convenient for west side residents.
host_about:
I am a Montana native, born and raised in Bozeman. I love it here and I never get tired of the breath taking mountain views.  I have been managing my own real estate rentals for over 20 years and appraising real estate here in the Gallatin Valley since 2007.  I am also a real estate broker at Starner Commercial Real Estate in Bozeman Montana.

I like to travel to warm locations. My husband and I honeymooned in Thailand and I hope to visit again someday.   My hobbies include hiking, spending time with family and working on real estate deals.   I've enjoyed being an AirBnB host and all the great people I've met along the way!

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.93 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
description:
Bright, modern, and tastefully appointed, this newly-built, gold-LEED house has it all. Cook in the light-flooded gourmet chef's kitchen; lounge in the beautiful backyard; enjoy your coffee on the back terrace or stroll to Main Street in just a few minutes.

Rest easy in this fully legal rental--we are registered with both Bozeman (Registration #17593) and Montana. With us your travel plans are 100% secure.

The space
New home with the highest-quality details – hardwood floors, integrated sound system, perennial flower gardens, Carrera marble, high-quality linens, deck and patio with Weber gas grill, all on a quiet, tree-lined street. The gold LEED certification comes with features like solar hot water, HEPA-filtered ventilation system, foot-thick insulated walls that keep you warm in winter and cool in summer. Its close proximity to Main Street, Montana State University, and great trails (just across the street) make it one of the best places you cou
neighborhood_overview: This house is located in the South Black South Tracy Historic District. Walk across the street from the house and you access Linear Trail, an old railroad line converted to a trail and perfect for your morning run. Connect from there to Peets Hill for fabulous views of the entire Gallatin Valley. Also three minutes from the house is Bogert Park, with a big playground and weekly farmer's markets in the summer. And, a few more paces brings you to the Bozeman Library.
host_about:
We have lived in the Bozeman area over 20 years and envisioned this dream home, which we built in 2010, as a blend of local historical architecture and modern design trends. It is our once and future primary residence, but while we're living out of state much of the year, we are ready to share our home with you. 
Sincerely, Otto & Anne

This beautiful two bedroom, two bath plus den dwelling is three blocks North of Main Street in downtown Bozeman. Hardwood floors, top-end kitchen and beautiful furnishings make this a special place. Substantial discount for month or longer booking. Occupancy limited to four persons. This unit is licensed by the city of Bozeman, STR20-00364

The space
Available for long-term only - Oct 1 to May 31. In the heart of Bozeman, this apartment can be your home away from home to visit friends and family, hike, bike, ski and enjoy the friendly outdoor lifestyle of Bozeman. The main level has one bedroom with a high-end Queen-sized bed. Also on the main level is a den with fold down sofa which makes a bed suitable for one person. A recent guest commented: "Our stay at Leslie's apt (really much more than an apt!) was special. Her place is beautifully designed and furnished...with a complete and modern kitchen, delightful bathroom and even a big screen TV. The front porc
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a custom home on a beautiful, tree-lined street across from Beall Park. It is three blocks from Main Street in downtown Bozeman. You can walk to local hiking and biking trails, enjoy the many good restaurants and interesting shops. Bridger Bowl Ski Area and Crosscut ski touring are 20 minutes away. Bozeman is a great place from which to access Yellowstone and Grand Teton National Parks, as well as Big Sky Resort. This can be your home away from home while in Bozeman.
host_about: I am retired but stay busy hiking, biking, kayaking and traveling.  Having lived in the Washington DC area for many years, I continue to enjoy its beauty and access to culture, art, theater, as well as biking and hiking trails. I have three grandchildren-- in Montana and Massachusetts—and visit them  several times a year, often staying at an AirBnB.  In 2015 I built a custom-designed duplex in Montana which has an apartment available through AirBnB.  I enjoy cooking but there are so many good places to eat around here (including some within walking distance), I often go out with friends.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.99 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
description:
We have over 186 five star reviews on VRBO as well as those you see here on Airbnb!
Bring your friends and family to this unique artsy home. Located in Bozeman's hip North East Neighborhood. Fully designed & remodeled with an artist's eye. Minutes walk to the heart of Main street. Enjoy luxurious sleep on our new organic hybrid mattresses & super soft 100% bamboo sheets! We prioritize health so that your can get out and fill your days with adventure and then sink into comfort!

The space
Bedrooms & baths:
This home is all on one level and has 4 bedrooms and two full baths. Hardwood flooring and unique tile work throughout! Soak up some warmth in our indoor sauna after playing in the snow or ease your sore muscles after a day on the slopes.
All four bedrooms have queen size beds with premium euro top natural mattresses. The master bedroom has a chaise lounge that would be comfortable for a child. Also our second bedroom has a loft designed for ch
neighborhood_overview: Our home is an easy stroll to tasty restaurants and shops. One block away is the main road to Bridger Bowl Ski Area. You are within walking distance to a shuttle service to the ski area & the Main Stream Bus Stop! Also an easy walk, you will find Bikram Yoga to warm you up and the Loft Spa which offers a sauna, steam room and cold plunge. There are many opportunities for scenic walks. Pete's hill is very close where you can take your dog and watch the sunset over Bozeman. Yellowstone National Park is an hour and a half drive through either the breathtaking Paradise River Valley or the Gallatin River Valley. Drive the Loop and take in the amazing wildlife of Montana. On your way, be sure to soak in the Historic Chico Hot Springs and Bozeman Hot Springs while you are here!
host_about: I am a health coach and energy medicine practitioner and my husband a contractor. We own a successful vacation rental in downtown Bozeman. We love accommodating travelers and seek out similar experiences when we travel.

neighborhood_overview: When visiting Bozeman there really is no better place to stay then right in the heart of downtown. Your apartment is 3 blocks away to the center of the downtown. name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Sleep in soft, beautiful bed linens with pretty patterns. Wake to songbirds, mountain views, and the smell of locally roasted coffee. Generous windows let natural light into fresh spaces filled with timeless, elegant furnishings. Petrified bamboo floors, & granite and stainless steel appliances add a special touch. A gleaming kitchen and living room offer panoramic Montana mountain views. Walking paths are just 1/2 block away to Myers Lake.

The space
This cozy, bright and airy loft is located over our detached garage. This is not an apartment or condo complex, but a private loft in a lovely residential neighborhood! It has been completely renovated with guests in mind. With 9 foot ceilings and large windows with lots of natural light and mountain views, you'll be sure to experience Montana panoramas. The kitchen is outfitted for a family of 4 to prepare gourmet meals, or eat on the go. Private off-street parking provided right next to loft. Well-mannered, house a
neighborhood_overview: The guesthouse is in a quiet, family-friendly, residential neighborhood, a short stroll to restaurants, bars, coffee, and a great walking path. Go fishing, ice-skating, and bird-watching at Meyers Lake, just 2 blocks away. Hiking trails and skiing abound.
host_about:
We love cooking and eating good food (especially ethnic!), music (eclectic), wine, travel, art, and time spent outdoors. Designed for the more independent traveler - our style of hosting is more hands off, allowing guests to experience Bozeman on their own agenda. *We are, however; always available by call or text to answer any question guests may have! 

We can't live without our fly-rods, skis, tents/Rpod, travel, and our hiking shoes. Our 13 year old Golden Retriever keep us thoroughly entertained!

Adventure meets luxury is our travel style; both domestically and internationally. 

Our MO: if you remain open to life, then no matter how old you are chronologically, you are still young. Also, run your own race!

neighborhood_overview: This is a safe and quiet neighborhood. There are walking trails that meander with the creek through nearly 30 acres of groomed and natural parklands. Major shopping centers and fine dining are within a few blocks.
host_about: Hello, I'm Jaymie. I enjoy hosting to those coming to Montana for a vacation. In my spare time I enjoy photographing beautiful Montana landscapes and wildlife. I love to travel and experiencing different areas and cultures. I love the outdoors.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.99 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
The Blue Willow Guest House is only 4 blocks from Historic Downtown Bozeman, so just a quick stroll to parks, music, bars, restaurants, galleries and great shopping. It is also close to MSU, the Museum and a short drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort!

The space
House is decorated in a country cozy style, with Montana nostalgia and original art and antiques. Beds have Pendleton blankets in the winter, high thread count sheets. Bathroom stocked lots of white fluffy towels and basics like shampoo and conditioner, body wash and soap. Fresh local coffee provided and there is also a Kurig with a variety of options.

Guest access
I will give you directions and information a few days before your arrival and provide you with your pin pad pass code the day you check-in.
neighborhood_overview: The Blue Willow was built in the late 1930's and many homes that surround it are of that era. It is a residential neighborhood with a great park and public pool 1 block away. Main street is 4 blocks away with great restaurants and retail shops. Trails to the mountains are a short walk away. Bridger Ski Resort is 16 miles away.
host_about: I am a Bozeman, Montana native who has returned to Bozeman after having big city adventures and realizing this is really " The Last Best Place." I own a retail business on Main Street just blocks away and I'm proud to share this special place with you! If you need anything during your stay or simply want recommendations, I'm available!

name: Hostel in Bozeman · ★4.63 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
description:
We are a safe, clean and affordable hostel located in downtown Bozeman close to all the popular bars, restaurants and hotspots. We are located extremely close to the free Streamline and Skyline bus pick-ups, making transportation to other areas easy.

We do not allow children under the age of 8.

The space
We are RIGHT next to all the downtown nightlife and amazing shops, restaurants, and other attractions! We are a basement hostel located in downtown Bozeman. Our common rooms (library and front TV room) have windows with natural light, but our individual rooms do not have windows.

Guest access
Free basic breakfast and free wifi

Other things to note
Bathrooms are SHARED, dorm-style so each room does not have a bathroom in it and the facilities are shared by the entire hostel. There is a women's bathroom and a men's bathroom (with a couple showers and toilets in the restroom).

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.81 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Free, fast WiFi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.

The space
The Garden Cottage is a wonderful free-standing one-room suite with no noises from the room next door because there is no room next door. Settle into this historic neighborhood and you'll be just 3 blocks from downtown Bozeman and 2 blocks from the up and coming Northeast urban district with Bozeman's best bakery.

Garden Cottage is managed by Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals, a small homegrown Bozeman company with over 20 years of experience. For more reviews and information, including a self-guided 3D walkthrough, search the name of the house plus the words Bozeman Cottage.

This converted Model-A barn is located in the backyard with private yard, alley entrance, and alley parking spot. It has been fully remodeled to include vaulted ceilings with skylights, a full kitchen, gas fireplace and clawfoot bathtub.

The kitchen, living area, and bedroom
neighborhood_overview: The northeast neighborhood of Bozeman is the artsy, alternative side of town. A short walk downtown opens up all the amenities there, and a few blocks away from downtown is one of Bozeman's favorite bakeries, Wild Crumb. There is a great new breakfast/lunch place just around the corner called UnKnotted. Great atmosphere and high quality offerings! MT Aleworks is 3 blocks away on Main St and has all the brewpub offerings and incredible burgers made with MT grassfed beef!
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

The space
Located in the heart of Yellowstone country, you can easily take advantage of all that this part of MT offers: Yellowstone Nat'l Park, world-class fly fishing and skiing, lots of outdoor sports and activities, historic downtown Bozeman, and many, many more attractions.

Happy Trails Vacation Condo is completely furnished with everything you need, except food! A/C, wireless, flat-screen TV's, ceiling fans in all rooms, two master bedrooms w/two private baths. DVD/VCR combo.

The space
Quiet, 2 bed, 2 bath condo on the second floor. First floor consist of 9-5 businesses, such as real estate offices, a hair salon, a massage condo, etc. Happy Trails Vacation Condo is fully furnished, with two TV's, cable, wireless internet, and all kitchen utensils. Stove, oven, microwave oven, full-size refrigerator and freezer with ice maker. Also, a coffee maker, toaster, and a blender. Bedding and towels are provided. name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.93 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
description:
This spacious 3 bed apartment is in an ideal Bozeman location. It is about a mile walk north to downtown, a mile walk west to MSU, a mile walk to the south lies the Museum of the Rockies, and a mile to the east on top of Peet's Hill in Burke Park.

Enjoy a home away from home, during your visit to Bozeman, at Bridger Guest House.

The space
This is a 850 sq ft 3 bedroom 1 bath. It has a stackable laundry center, full kitchen with cooking utensils, a full bath, which includes towels, and the bedrooms have hangars and bedding. It is furnished, and has a computer station, with laptop space, and a small library which you can use as a resource to plan your trip in the area. Please return the books. The living room has a TV, DVD player, and internet/wifi.

Guest access
The entire yard and apartment is included.

Other things to note
We routinely water, weed, and mow the grass, usually on the weekends, but if the weat
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quintessential college town neighborhood, but boasts great access to the city trail system and nearby parks. Christie fields, Bogert Park, Lindley Park, Burke Park/Peet's Hill, and the Gallagator Linear Trail system are all very close. There are MANY small independent coffee shops/breweries/eateries within walking distance, and of course, the campus of MSU and downtown are about a mile away.

If you are a student, or family of a student, looking to check out the campus for MSU Fridays, or just whenever, let Mike know, as he is a graduate of the Microbiology program, and can fill you in. This may be the best neighborhood for college kids in town, as it is quieter, has amazing access to the town and its amenities, and sits in the middle of much of the downtown parklands.
host_about:
We are a family of four who live in Bozeman, MT. We met doing seasonal work in Yellowstone in 2004, and that was only the start of our ongoing adventure, which now includes two little girls.

We pride ourselves in knowing all of the secret spots in the surrounding Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. We have an informative guidebook which can be useful when planning your adventures. It includes information about all manners of trips in the surrounding dozen different mountain ranges: hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, whitewater rafting, caving,  skiing/snowboarding/Xcountry, fishing, boating/rafting, horseback riding, large animal and bird spotting, and much more. We also offer up an up to date city guide with ideas on what to do in or awesome town in between trips into the wilderness.

We are a young outdoorsy couple with a lot of travel experience, mostly in the big empty lands of our world. We are open to all types of people, whether young, old, LGBT, religious/athiest, brown, white, yellow, pink, or purple.

Best location in Bozeman!
Downtown Bozeman's Main Street, restaurants, shopping, local trails & parks, Sweet Pea Festival, Farmer's Market, swimming pool, library, and local grocery are all within walking distance!
You’ll love this gorgeous remodel of our 1890s farmhouse because of the prime location & quiet neighborhood.
Our place is great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).

The space
This strikingly beautiful remodel complements the charm of this cute historic 1890s Bozeman home. There is a spacious living area with newly remodeled kitchen (and fold out sleeper couch), bedroom with queen size bed and double closets, bathroom with claw foot porcelain bathtub and sink, custom shower, and laundry.
Please note that there is a separate small apartment upstairs with a completely separate entrance and very quiet tenant.

Guest access
Guests have access to the parking space on the wes
neighborhood_overview:
This historic Bozeman home is located just one block off of historic East Main street in Bozeman, making it the perfect location to explore downtown Bozeman and the Main Street to the Mountains trail system. Prepare to park your car and enjoy this walking neighborhood :-)
This is generally a quiet neighborhood. You can expect occasional noise typical of a downtown neighborhood (sirens, motorcycle engines, and late night "bar hoppers"), and at certain times of year (Sweet Pea Festival, parades, running events, etc.) you may find yourself very near the "center of things".

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
description:
Greetings! A great space with an amazing view is available for long-term rental. It is close to MSU Campus, Museum of the Rockies, Cafe M Coffee, Restaurants, Pizza, a 24-hour gym, and Kagy Korner (with ice cream by the scoop!). The trail system is close by and Bozeman Deaconess is a 5-minute drive away. You’ll love this home because of the tree-house/ski chalet feel and the views to the hills from your balcony. Bikes are available for use, and there is plenty of parking in the neighborhood.

The space
The space is a large third-floor room, with a private full bath, with a shower and tub that boast a view of Mt. Blackmore! The room has a south-facing balcony through sliding glass doors with an outside cafe table & chairs. Noise-reducing curtains were recently added behind the shuttered windows visible in the listing picture to increase the privacy of the rental space. These shutters overlook an infrequently used office space, hence the 'loft-feel' of the space
neighborhood_overview: I love our Bozeman Creek neighborhood! We have a nice little spring creek that runs right next to our place. We have great neighbors, plenty of parking, a nice view of Pete's hill, trails, and a park nearby - all in a very quiet pocket of town in a sweet location.
host_about: Greetings!  I choose Montana as my home when I was 6 years old, after seeing pictures of Glacier National Park.  Nutley, New Jersey is a great place to be from, and Bozeman, Montana has been a wonderful place to live for the last 29 years.  Outdoor adventures, dancing, dinosaurs under the microscope, and my delightful daughter make up a lot of life.  You will find plenty of books on science and spirituality in our cool and cozy home - as well as a new indoor slack-line!

host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

description:
Furnished with all new furnishings, our second level carriage house is available for a memorable vacation getaway!
It's quiet and tranquil setting allows you to relax and unwind after a day of exploring, and its many COMFORTS do not disappoint.

The space
This quaint and modern apartment is "conveniently" located in the award winning Valley West neighborhood and features a gas fireplace for the cooler months, window air conditioner for the summer months, and private driveway parking. It stands alone, exclusively, over top of a detached garage for further privacy and much deserved downtime.

Our charming carriage house is freshly painted and fully furnished with; top of the line West elm linens, and plush (Saatva) Beautyrest KING mattress) as well as full-size air mattress bed for third guest.
It also furnishes household amenities such as a front load washer and dryer, fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, and refrigerator. We wan
neighborhood_overview: Our quaint but modern apartment is "conveniently" located in the award winning Valley West neighborhood.  It is located close to many of Bozeman's attractions. In addition,  It is only 10 miles from the Bozeman Yellowstone International airport.
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.88 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
description:
Modern Southbridge Cottage

The space
This fabulous, single level, 3 bedroom, 2 bath house is great for everyone including people with limited mobility. The open floor plan combines the dining, kitchen, and living room with large windows and plenty of natural light. The spacious master bedroom has a large bathroom with a walk in, tiled shower and dual vanities.
Enjoy the amenities of a Keurig coffee maker, Drip coffee maker, large flat screen tvs, toaster oven, Traeger grill, pack & play, high chair, and board games.

Located just off of S. 19th, you will have quick access to Hyalite recreational area and numerous trailheads south of Bozeman. The two car garage leaves plenty of room for toys whether it be bikes, boats, or skis!

Guest access
Guests have access to the entire home minus the cleaning closet.

Other things to note
Dogs allowed with additional fee. No cats.
neighborhood_overview:
Southbridge is the newest subdivision to on the south side of Bozeman, just off of S. 19th, yet close to Montana State University. Southbridge has numerous walking trails, ponds, and parks. The subdivsion mainly consists of single family homes and it fairly quiet.

This location is prime for people wanting to quickly access the trailheads in Hyalite Recreation Area as well as Sourdough/Bozeman Creek Trail, Cottonwood Canyon, and Leverich Canyon.
host_about:
Dream MT Properties, formally "Cozy Creek", is proud to be a small rental agency that gives special attention to its owners as well as guests. When planning your next trip to the Big Sky area, you will deal with very few people who understand what it takes to make a vacation great for your group coming in.  We pride ourselves in have a properties that are clean, well stocked, and in a great location.

Not only are we a small company that delivers one on one customer service, we also love giving free advice on where to eat, hike, ski, fish, play and sight see while you are visiting.

name: Cabin in Bozeman · ★4.98 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
The Cabin On Montana offers guests a quiet comfortable place to stay while visiting beautiful Bozeman, Montana. The cabin was fully renovated in the summer and fall of 2016. It is well adorned with new mattresses, furniture, and appliances. The cabin is well situated with quick access to Bridger Bowl and other highlights in the area. It is a short walk or bike to the center of downtown or one of Bozeman's many breweries or restaurants.

The space
The Cabin On Montana is well appointed with all new high efficiency appliances including a washer and electric steam dryer, refrigerator with ice-maker, garbage disposal, dish washer, microwave, gas range, range hood and vacuum. The kitchen is fully stocked with kitchenware and service ware for eight or more. There is a small growler collection for you to use to fill up at the local breweries. The cabin features partial light top-down bottom-up blinds in the kitchen and living spaces and full dark-down bottom-up blinds in
neighborhood_overview: The Cabin On Montana is located in a residential neighborhood seven blocks north of downtown.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
My place is a quaint little condo with all the amenities of home. The windows throughout have views of the Bridger Mountains. Centrally located with a short drive to downtown, grocery stores, etc. with easy access to all your mountain escapes.

All-new paint, appliances, modern furniture, kitchenware, linens etc. It's located in a small business district for convenient parking and building access. Good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).

The space
The layout is very convenient with two bedrooms each with their own attached bathroom with living room and kitchen in the middle. Bathrooms are stocked with body soap, shampoo and conditioner. There is also a full stocked washer and dryer right inside the condo unit available for use by all guests.

Guest access
The condo is within a small and easily accessible business district. There is an outside door that accesses four 2nd floor condos above
neighborhood_overview: As mentioned previously, the condo is in a convenient central Bozeman location which is 2 miles from downtown, 2 miles from Montana State university and within blocks of grocery stores, several restaurants and other amenities.
host_about: I live full-time in Knoxville, TN and have been visiting my son and family in Bozeman for nearly 20 years.  Now with my one and only grandchild in Bozeman I am looking forward to spending  more time there.  Since I can not be there full time I am opening my home away from home to you.  Please remember this is my home and treat it as if it were your own.

Come enjoy all that Bozeman has to offer in your home-away-from-home.
Relax and unwind in our sparkly clean, and very comfortable Bozeman escape!
Conveniently located to all of Bozeman's hot spots. Always FREE high speed internet!!

The space

description:
Our comfortable, newly constructed studio apartment offers privacy and is steps from a lake with a pavilion, walking trails, park, and playground. The large rooftop deck is ideal for a private morning breakfast or taking in evening mountain top views. Located in a desirable, charming neighborhood, the studio (carriage house) is perfect for the traveler seeking adventure (skiing, fishing, biking, hiking) or business in Bozeman and it's surrounding areas.

The space
The studio loft has a fully equipped kitchen, Keurig coffee maker, plush pillow top queen bed - super comfy, 60" plasma tv, turntable with vintage albums (bring your vinyl!), Bluetooth speaker, private carport, and LARGE ROOFTOP DECK with a cafe table and additional seating. Our unit is a loft studio in an award-winning residential neighborhood. As travelers, we value cleanliness and will make maximum effort as hosts to provide the same.

Guest access

Our loft studio is conveniently located near most of what Bozeman has to offer including restaurants, grocery, parks, trails, MSU, and the downtown area. Guests planning trips to Yellowstone or Big Sky will appreciate the studio's convenient proximity to the entrance of Gallatin canyon.

Distance to the Airport is 15 min, Bridger bowl 30 min, Big Sky 50 min, Livingston 40 min, and West Yellowstone is 1.5 hrs.

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
description:
Hike, bike, golf, ski or just view the mountains! They are all available right out your back door at this lovely townhome ideally located next to Bridger Creek Golf Course and the Bridger mountains. The trail system with endless trails, perfect for summer hiking or biking or winter cross country skiing, runs adjacent to the townhome and Bridger Bowl is only a 15-minute drive away. Or in five minutes you can be in downtown Bozeman and all it has to offer.

The space
Key Residence Features:
- Wireless internet, cable TV
- 30 day minimum stay required
- Gas fireplace
- A/C
- 2- car garage
- Patio and small BBQ grill
- Located near Bridger Creek Golf Course and Bridger Mountains
- Only 15-minutes from Bridger Bowl Ski Area and adjacent to trail system

Bedroom Configuration:
- Master bedroom: king-sized bed
- Second bedroom: queen-sized bed
- Third bedroom: sleeper sofa

Amenitie
host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
description:
***We are open and following AirBnB's guidelines on cleaning and protocols to keep our guests safe, and provide our guests with extra cleaning supplies to feel safer at our home. ***

With 3 beds and 1 bath, and 2 outdoor spaces, in roughly 900 sq ft, the home is a welcome respite from the road, or plane! The home has wifi, full laundry/bath/and kitchen and 2 off street parking spots.

The space
The guest house is one level, and is a perfect size for accommodations during a trip. With 2 decks, and a patio (the patio is still being constructed), there is room to sit and enjoy the outdoors, or grill some food.

There are 4 beds total, and 2 are softer, and 2 are about medium soft. The medium queen bed is in the first bedroom, and the softer queen is in the back large bedroom. The twin beds are both in the same room, and one is soft, while the other is harder.

The bedrooms, baths, laundry area, and other areas are furnished and stocked
neighborhood_overview:
If we are full during your trip, check out our other listings:
-Exact floor plan and location with larger yard? Bridger Guest house may be open as well.

Our guest homes are located in University Subdivision, and tucked behind the Gallagator Trail on Bozeman's south side. Our neighborhood is located very close to 5 large municipal parks.

Bozeman Public Library / Lindley Park / Peet's Hill area just south of Main St. is a great family walk after a night enjoying the Downtown bars and restaurants.

To the west and south west, is Montana State University, and is a few minutes away by bike or walk. Enjoy football games, Museum of the Rockies, graduations, move-in/outs, and do some research and stay with us!
host_about:
We are a family of four who live in Bozeman, MT. We met doing seasonal work in Yellowstone in 2004, and that was only the start of our ongoing adventure, which now includes two little girls.

We pride ourselves in knowing all of the secret spots in the surrounding Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. We have an informative guidebook which can be useful when planning your adventures. It includes information about all manners of trips in the surrounding dozen different mountain ranges: hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, whitewater rafting, caving,  skiing/snowboarding/Xcountry, fishing, boating/rafting, horseback riding, large animal and bird spotting, and much more. We also offer up an up to date city guide with ideas on what to do in or awesome town in between trips into the wilderness.

We are a young outdoorsy couple with a lot of travel experience, mostly in the big empty lands of our world. We are open to all types of people, whether young, old, LGBT, religious/athiest, brown, white, yellow, pink, or purple.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.83 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
description:
*NOTE: Our home is only available for reservations of 30 nights or more.*

Welcome to our spacious 3b/2b single-story home, nestled in a quiet neighborhood among beautiful Big Sky Country. With a wealth of nearby parks, easy access to Bozeman's historic downtown with its local shopping and trendy restaurants, let our home be the basecamp for your unforgettable adventure. The light, airy layout makes for an easy departure from the clutter and chaos of the real world.

The space
Step into a picture of serenity: an uncluttered oasis where cozy elements and rustic flair mingle against a backdrop of beautiful hardwood floors, vaulted ceilings, and upgraded amenities.

Leave your worries (and your coat) in the slate entryway, and step into the Living Room, where comfy recliners and a cushy couch frame a large, indoor fireplace. This room receives plenty of warm afternoon light, perfect for illuminating your favorite book or family board game.
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded and immersed in all the natural beauty Big Sky Country as to offer, Bozeman retains it's historic roots while embodying the thriving spirit of a college town. Do you long for hiking trails minutes from your door? Camping opportunities? The driving range? The slopes? Would you love to learn about the natural history of the American frontier but also want to experience some great eats and a thriving nightlife? Bozeman offers all that, and more!

Not all your plans have to be so ambitious. Parks both sprawling and hidden are scattered around the city, meaning you're never far from the varied Montana wildlife. Take a ten minute walk north from the house and you'll reach the Gallatin County Regional Park; a little further East and you can play a round of frisbee golf in Rose Park.

Other daytime activities include boutique shopping downtown and museum hopping, including the Museum of the Rockies, which houses the largest T-rex skull in the world.

Ou
host_about: We love to travel, and during our adventures in Europe, Costa Rica, and the Caribbean Islands, we've noticed that it's the little things that make all the itinerary planning and redeye flights worth it. Originally from California, we've fallen in love with the wilds of Montana and Wyoming, and plan to start a family in Bozeman one day. In the spirit of family, we'd love to invite you into our home, so that you can experience all the magic we felt when first exploring this exciting, crazy, beautiful land.

The space
Key Residence Features:
- Located in historic downtown Bozeman

Stay Montana provides the following compleme
host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!
