name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
description:
*No cleaning fee!*

**Note: To minimize health concerns for everyone, common areas of the home are now off-limits to guests.

We have a cozy home conveniently located less than 30 minutes from Bridger Bowl and less than 5 minutes from shopping and dining. Downtown is a very short drive or bike ride away! The neighborhood is quiet and pleasant. You will get your own private room and full bathroom upstairs tucked away from the rest of the home.

Guest access
- Private bedroom and full bathroom tucked away from rest of home.
- Street parking

During your stay
I am generally available for assistance with some notice unless I am out of town for some reason. Feel free to message me on the app!

Other things to note
1 friendly black lab lives in the home, but has restricted access to the upper level/guest room.
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in a very quiet family oriented neighborhood tucked away from all the main roads. We’re within walking distance to 3 grocery stores, Cold Stone, the Barmuda triangle with 3 different bars and frequent food trucks off Main street and shopping on 19th ave. We’re also a 5min drive (or a 35 minute walk) to downtown Bozeman. We’re also a short drive to the university. It’s really easy to get pretty much anywhere in Bozeman, and we’re near all the main roads that access the interstate, Bridger Canyon, Hyalite and more.
host_about:
I like to learn more about the places I am visiting! I like history, nature, wildlife. When I visit a new place I love to try the local cuisine, learn the local history, walk or hike and try new activities. 

I have been to almost every state in the lower 48 along with several other countries. I enjoy outdoor sports, offroading, photography and learning more about human and natural history through National Parks and Monuments, museums, etc.

description:
See the beauty of Montana when you stay at this 3-bed, 3.5-bath vacation rental house in Bozeman. This spacious home offers 3,000 square feet and comfortably sleeps a large amount of guests, making it perfect for families, couples, and outdoor enthusiasts alike. Make daily plans on the back patio while lounging on outdoor table and chairs. Whether it's walking the streets of downtown or hiking through the mountains, there's something for everyone in this charming mountain town!

The space
Bedroom 1: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Queen Bed | Bonus Room: Queen Sleeper Sofa | Living Room: Queen Sleeper Sofa | Additional Sleeping: Queen Air Mattress

Unpack your clothes and unwind in the living room which features 2 plush couches, armchair, a gas-burning fireplace, and a flat-screen Smart satellite TV.

Pull up a stool and keep the chef of the group company at the breakfast bar while they prepare delicious meals in the fully equip
neighborhood_overview:
Breathe the fresh mountain air as you walk the streets of downtown Bozeman and explore the boutique shops, art galleries, restaurants, museums, and more. Take a unique tour of the local breweries when you visit Tour de Foam which includes pickup and dropoff, free beer, free food, and more.

Get the thrill of a lifetime when you check out Grizzly Encounter, a sanctuary that is home to rescued bears and offers visitors an up close and personal view of these animals. See a beautiful 80-foot waterfall when you hike Palisades Falls National Recreation Trail.

Grab your skis and head to Bridger Bowl Ski Area offering 2,000 acres of skiable terrain and over 75 trails. You can also take the hour-long drive to Big Sky for true world-class skiing.

Montana has some of the best fly fishing in the country and Montana Angler offers unique trips for the anglers of the group. Take a fishing trip via horseback, an overnight trip, or just a full day trip for a chance to
host_about:

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.96 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
The OYA house is a modern, well appointed home in a quiet, peaceful neighborhood. Enjoy two floors of privacy, a well-stocked kitchen, in-home laundry, and the warm, inviting ambience that this home provides.
Included is a private fenced backyard, secure garage and access to a park, lake and trails within steps of the home. Enjoy the quiet and restorative qualities along with the convenience of its central location.
Downtown (2.5 miles), MSU (3 miles), Bridger Bowl (20 miles) Big Sky (40 miles)

The space
Aside from luxurious, the house is also green - surpassing EnergyStar standards. With high ceilings, a modern aesthetic and all the amenities, including updated central AC, you will enjoy the feeling of hotel hospitality while having the comforts of home.

The bathroom and kitchen are stocked with all the supplies you will need, as well as high end cookware and place settings, extra blankets, pillows and sheets, and lots of books and games.
neighborhood_overview:
Located a just a few steps from Valley West Park, this Townhome sits in a very quiet, family oriented neighborhood. If you're looking to party, this isn't the place. But if you want rest, and relaxation, this is for you.

You can get to Downtown Bozeman within 15 minutes by car. The Streamline bus stop is a 5 minute walk away, located at the corner of Cascade St. and Ferguson Ave.
host_about: I am an architect and full-time faculty at Montana State University; my wife is a community relations manager. We love design and traveling and know the importance of having a great, quiet place to relax and recharge while on an adventure. We love Bozeman and we try and keep the cost down so that everyone can see the area and what it has to offer.

description:
Modern loft on the southside of Bozeman. Great views out and the open space full of wildlife.

Close to downtown, MSU and the Bobcat stadium. Walk or bike downtown on Bozeman's great network of trails or hike up the hill to enjoy a beautiful Montana sunset.

The apartment is on top of the garage and has a separate entrance. One bedroom with king bed, upper loft with two twin beds, full kitchen, bath, living/dining area and laundry. Everything you need for your stay!

License #: STR20-00368

The space
Modern open layout with great views!
The property is above the garage with its own entrance.

The kitchen is well appointed with everything you need including Keurig coffee maker, pots and pans, blender, toaster, knives utensils, spices, ect. We provided coffee and tea essentials. The kitchen has island seating and there is a dining table for 6. The deck has outdoor seating and is partially covered it.

The
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet neighborhood. There is a great park across the street and easy access to the Gallagator Trail which leads to Downtown, Bogart Park, Museum of the Rockies, library and the rest of the trail system. Langhor trail has a climbing boulder. Peet's Hill/Burke park is a short walk across the creek and up the hill. MSU is a short walk away.

Bridger Bowl ski area is about a 30 minute drive away and Big Sky Resort is a little over an hour. Yellowstone National Park is about an hour and 40 minutes.

description:
Cozy, quaint, and cost-effective, we offer a private room with a comfortable queen bed in downtown Bozeman. We're four short blocks from the heart of historic Main Street and the main Streamline bus stop/hub. There is a fenced back yard, a dedicated back door entrance, and a portable privacy wall - to give you your 'space' (well.....and us too). Our eclectic 60's rancher is a short drive to the local ski hills, golf courses, and MSU. Bus lic. (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

There are a couple steps to get to the back yard, and a couple steps up to the back door. We also do not provide breakfast, but there are many wonderful breakfast options just a few blocks away on Main Street.
neighborhood_overview: We live in an older part of town.  There are renters to the south and an assisted living house with employees to the north of our home.  We cannot control their activities.  We also appreciate that this can create challenges for our guests at times.  Nevertheless, the  parking is free, and is usually available directly in front of our house...but it does get busy at times.  We usually park in our garage in the back alley, so you are welcome to park on the street directly in front of our house.
host_about: I work at Montana State University, have two grown sons, and am an avid golfer.  I love to travel, meet new people, and I research stained glass windows that represent American civil religion.

host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. neighborhood_overview: Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even a solo trip. Come and explore all tha

Unwritten & Company | Reservations & Guest Services 

At your service,

VR Bozeman | Vacation Rentals

host_about:

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.92 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
This spacious townhome was designed with you in mind!
We fashioned this home with an open floor plan and many added comforts for a memorable vacation getaway.
Come relax and unwind in our cozy Bozone Bliss!
Always FREE high speed internet!!

The space
Just five years old, this fully furnished (with all new furnishings) charming townhome was custom built with you in mind! We've included top of the line linens, and plush Sealy Merriment KING mattress for the master suite, as well as plush Sealy queen mattresses for the other two rooms. It can sleep 7 guests, with a pull out "memory mattress sofa bed" in the downstairs living room.

For your added comfort and ambience, this modern town home has an electric fireplace in the living room for the cold wintery nights, and CENTRAL AIR-CONDITIONING throughout the home for the hot summer months. Spacious single car garage with garage opener, driveway parking, and street parking available.
neighborhood_overview: This cozy retreat is "conveniently" located in a family friendly and "award winning Valley West" neighborhood steps from a playground, park, small lake, and walking trails. Four groceries, a fish market, banks, gas stations, and the Gallatin Valley Mall are all within a short bike ride or up to a five-minute drive, as well as a ten minute drive to downtown Bozeman.
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Our spacious 2BR suite in always-popular Bozeman might just be the Big Sky experience you’ve been searching for! We’re kid and pet-friendly and hope you bring them along to enjoy the gorgeous mountain and golf course views. We think we’re in the perfect location, with ski-in/ski-out, golf-in/golf-out, and fish-in/fish-out just minutes or even seconds from our door. We’re also just 5 minutes from downtown Bozeman for shopping, & dining 15 mins from the closest ski resort. STR20-00319

The space
Savor spectacular sunsets over the snow-capped Bridger mountains from the deck of your Big Sky vacation home in convenient Bozeman. Located on the 17th hole of Bridger Creek Golf Course, you’ll marvel at the lush carpet of emerald-green grass and the peaceful, quiet atmosphere.

Living Spaces

With a great room reminiscent of a stately lodge, your family is sure to love everything this space offers. For the kids, there are plenty of games and toys to kee
neighborhood_overview:
You’ll never lack for things to do while visiting Bozeman! In the heart of Big Sky country, Bozeman offers nearly endless activities, attractions, restaurants, shopping, and outdoor adventures. Here are just a few of our favorites.

Outdoor Activities & Attractions

Palisade Falls
Bridger Bowl Ski Area
Montana Grizzly Encounter
Gallatin River
Yellowstone Safari Company
Montana Angler Fly Fishing
Crosscut Mountain Sport Center
Big Sky Resort on Andesite Mountain
Madison River Tubing
Montana Alpine Guides

Museums

Museum of the Rockies
American Computer and Robotics Museum
Gallatin History Museum
Bozeman Sculpture Park

Cultural Activities

Bozeman Symphony
The Ellen Theater

Shopping

Gallatin Valley Mall
Downtown Bozeman, Mainstreet

And of course, what’s vacation without trying some new restaurants? We hope you’ll lose these
host_about:
Hello, my name is Erik and my lovely wife and cohost is Pepper. We originally built our 1200 sq. ft. addition for our family to come visit us but as they aged and with covid, it got too hard for them to visit. So we decided to start sharing it with guests from all over the world and it has been a wonderful experience. We truly love meeting our wonderful guests and getting to know them. 

Like so many other hosts, our family of 5 (plus Timber, our 1.5-year-old Chocolate Lab) loves to travel and we have been fortunate to see many places around the world.  Living in Montana has given all of us a deep appreciation of the natural world and its infinite activities. We all enjoy hiking, camping, rock climbing, and skiing. We have hiked all over Yellowstone and throughout the Gallatin mountains. 

In the springtime, I fly fish almost nightly in the two rivers behind our home on the other side of the Bridger Creek Golf Course.

When we’re not ticking off the boxes on our family bucket list, I am a Customer Service Representative for Delta and United Airlines and Pepper is a Pediatrician at Bozeman Deaconess Hospital.

We can’t wait to meet you!

Beautiful backyard trails with gorgeous views of Mt. Ellis for walking, running, xc skiing, mountain biking, with trails connecting to downtown. Views of the Bridger’s is a minute down the trail behind the house.

Walking downtown takes about 15 min. Give or take depending on your pace.

Security deposit required for stays longer than 10 nights.
host_about:
I’ve been enjoying the MAGICAL 
outdoors from the mountains to the ocean all of my life. 

Bozeman usually has beautiful weather, with too many summer activities to list from biking hiking kitesurfing you name it!…winter skiing both downhill + xc are some of the best in the world. The fishing is phenomenal, the people amazingly friendly + the town of Bozeman has so much to offer..Come play in the outdoors!  Happy to make some great suggestions!

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.67 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3.5 baths
description:
Capture the essence of Bozeman from this historic Fred Willson vacation rental nestled in the BonTon District. This 23-bedroom, 3.5 bathroom townhome is home to a sunlight infrared sauna, jetted and lighted tub, exercise and yoga room, sunlit deck, and more! Gran Haven is just a short walk through the tree-lined streets to Main Street, where you can wine, dine and explore! Outdoor enthusiasts will love the proximity to the mountains for hiking, biking, fishing, hunting, skiing and more!

The space
Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2 (The Little Room): Twin Bed | Bedroom 3: Queen Bed | Library: Sleeper Sofa

Leave your worries at the door of this stunning home boasting 1,850 square feet of tastefully ornament living space highlighted by hardwood floors, elegant decor, and a gourmet kitchen!

Sprawl out on the sumptuous sofas in the living room - complete with a gas fireplace and a 55-inch flat-screen Satellite TV.

Your holiday cuisine
neighborhood_overview:
You'll love the proximity to downtown Bozeman! This city is brimming with hidden gems, such as the American Computer Museum, Emerson Cultural Center, and the Museum of the Rockies! A little further away is North Wilson Avenue boasting a variety of shops, restaurants, cozy cafes, and more!

Close to the home is the iconic Story Mansion hosting many private parties, events, and weddings. Other nearby attractions include the Lindley Park with a cross-country skiing trail, as well as Bridger Creek Golf Course with breathtaking mountain views!

No matter the time of year, there's always an outdoor activity to enjoy nearby, from hiking at Yellowstone National Park to skiing at Bridger Bowl when the snow falls. In the summertime, be sure to check out the serene beauty of Palisade Falls, the Gallatin River, and Grotto Falls Trail! Start your days with a scenic hike on the Gallagator Trail- just 3 blocks away!

MSU parents or alumni will be thrilled to be walkin

host_about: 10 years ago I moved to beautiful Bozeman, Montana. I instantly fell in love with the Mountains that surround Bozeman and all that they have to offer. In the summer, you can find me exploring a new hiking trail with my kids and in the winter, we will be on the slopes either at Bridger Bowl or Big Sky. I travel frequently for my job so I rent out my home while I am gone. I also have the privilege of helping my mom rent out her home next door while she spends part of the year in Texas.

host_about: Hi there! I've lived in Bozeman since 1987. I absolutely love Montana and love sharing it. I work hard here in order to play and stay here. I believe that Montana has a special energy and have thought that ever since I first visited, the people and the land. Big Sky country, the Last Best Place, all true descriptions, stunningly beautiful, you can see for miles and although we have longer winters here than some, the sun shines more here than any other place I have lived.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
description:
A quiet & cozy spot in the heart of Bozeman, where you can read a book by the fire or sit outside, on the covered patio, and be amazed by the views of the Bridger Mountains. The valley offers many things to do in the winter AND the summer. Downhill skiing 15 miles away, cross county skiing right in town, ice climbing & snow shoeing are some winter activities. Water sports, amazing hike and trail system, fishing, rafting & mountain biking are some of our favorite summer activities.

The space
Our place offers a convenient place to springboard into many wonder activities in the Gallatin Valley. We have buses that can run you up to Big Sky Ski Resort or to Bridger Bowl. We have a garage if you prefer to drive your own vehicle on your Bozeman adventure! We are close to MSU for concerts, rodeos and sporting events.

Guest access
You will have access and use of the whole main level of the home. There is a second level that is locked off. It h
neighborhood_overview: We are in a neighborhood of single family homes and town homes.  There is a large, open space, right out the back door that you can go throw a frisbee in, or just hang out.  There is park down the street for the kiddos.  We are only a few minutes drive from down town. There you will find The Museum of the Rockies, fabulous restaurants, fantastic antique stores and many quaint little stores with items made/painted by local artists. We are only about 5 minutes from MSU.

The space
The owners live upstairs and we have 2 cats but they are not allowed downstairs. The basement still has many original features including the speckled linoleum flooring. host_about:
I have lived in Bozeman, Montana for over 30 years. 
My longtime partner, Maxwell is an avid cyclist with the men's master cycling team and spends much of his free time riding and training. He also enjoys baking artisan breads and pizza. I love to hike and garden. I also have a passion for textiles and enjoy learning traditional handcrafts such as Shibori and Indigo dyeing, quilting (and too many more to list!)

host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

name: Cottage in Bozeman · ★5.0 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
This is a lovely little standalone studio on Bozeman's Northside. Built in 2004, this studio is clean, tidy, and in great condition.

Located on Wallace Ave and within a few blocks of downtown, it's midway between Wild Crumb and Montana Ale Works.

This is a medium-term rental, with a minimum 30-day stay required. Longterm discounts are negotiable.

FYI: We only list this property on Airbnb. Listings on other online platforms are fraudulent. Beware!

The space
The floor area is 480 square feet, with a small loft suitable for storage that adds another 125 square feet. One corner of the main floor is dedicated to a sleeping space, with a queen bed and privacy screen. The walls and sloped ceilings are finished in drywall and wood. The floors are burnished concrete that deliver radiant heat. The cabinetry is euro-style Douglas Fir, with stone and tile counters. The ample windows are double-glazed for comfort and quietness, and all the
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet old neighborhood of mostly single-family homes. It's a three-block walk to downtown Bozeman.
host_about:
Amy is the Development Program Manager for The Nature Conservancy in Montana. She has also worked as an expedition leader for the eco-tourism company Orbridge, hosting travelers across the western US and on the rivers of Western Europe. 

Amy's husband Chris is the founder of Habitat X, director of the Montana Weatherization Training Center, and an author in the sustainable housing industry.

Amy and Chris live in Bozeman, Montana.

neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood that's close to most attractions including MSU, downtown, airport.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

description:
Cozy 2 bedroom cottage conveniently located in beautiful private setting right in the middle of town. Cottage sits next to Bozeman Creek on a one acre lot, wildlife frequents the area. The cottage is very close to Montana State University and Bobcat stadium, about 1 mile from historic downtown Bozeman and 2 miles from Bozeman Deaconess Hospital. Parks as well as hiking and cross country ski trails are located nearby. Downhill skiing and Yellowstone Park are within driving distance.

The space
Each of the roomy bedrooms has a private full bathroom attached. Cottage has both a front and back deck. If you leave the windows open (summer), you can hear the sound of water flowing in Bozeman Creek. Lots of trees and open area around the cottage.

Guest access
The cottage is its own structure separate from the main house. Cottage has its own private walkway and entrance.

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview: Cottage is located within a neighborhood of single family homes and duplexes.  Park with a playground is located right across the street.   Local gas station and convenience store located in the neighborhood.  In addition, a coffee shop, dry cleaners, Rosa's Pizza and great Italian restaurant are just up the street.
host_about:
My family and I  feel  so fortunate to be living in an area of the country that many people desire to visit. As an Airbnb host we hope that our cottage and hospitatlity are as impressive as the scenery surrounding our beautiful city. We want your trip to Bozeman to be all that it can be and we know that it all starts with a memorable lodging experience. 
If you are thinking about moving to Monatana I would feel privlaged to help you find that perfect property to call home. I am a License Realtor in the State of Montana and I would love to send you listings prior to your visit. 
My family and I look forward to your visit and until then take care and stay healthy.

The space
The Peach House is an extensively and beautifully remodeled 2-bedroom 2-bath home on Bozeman's north side, close to a 2-block city park, and a short walk to downtown Main Street (5 blocks away) as is also nearby the Fairgrounds where the summer and wintler Farmer's Markets are held. Now with 400 Meg internet service and 220 volt electric vehicle charging port!

Peach House is owned and managed by Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals, a small homegrown Bozeman company with over 20 years of experience. For more reviews and information, including a self-guided 3D walkthrough, search the name of the house plus the words Bozeman Cottage.

neighborhood_overview: Residential neighborhood with large park just a block away.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Meadowlark Guesthouse offers a cool morning jaunt or evening stroll with its neighborhood parks and walking trails. Surrounded by the Rockies, we are conveniently located in Bozeman with amenities close at hand: BZN Airport 15 minutes away, Montana State with its Museum of the Rockies and division one athletics, skiing at Big Sky and Bridger Bowl, as well as hiking, fishing, rafting, hot springs and Yellowstone Park. Make this a hub for all the explorations Montana has to offer.

The space
Park your car and hang your skis in the attached garage to keep everything warm and dry.

Computer work spaces are available as well as a monitor (bring your own cables).
neighborhood_overview: Set in a quiet residential area within Bozeman, this neighborhood has walking paths, and  is close to necessary amenities.
host_about:
I am a Montana born gal who married a Minnesota guy leaving for what I thought were greater adventures. Over time I realized my heart never left. I yearned to hike in the spacious beauty of the mountains, to sleep peacefully through the quiet, cool nights awakening to the crisp, mountain air in the mornings and to hear the meadowlark’s song as it lilts through the big sky.

With graciousness and love from my husband, we opened Meadowlark Guesthouse  in 2022. May Meadowlark Guesthouse be one of your safe havens to which you will want to return and enjoy Montana as much as we do.

If you love the 60's vibe - this is your place! Lots of wood paneling and a super cozy feel.

3 Bedroom (1 twin bunk beds, 2 queen beds), 1 bath very spacious basement apartment.

Small seating area in the kitchen and a funky living area next to the bunk room!

Washer and dryer in the unit make cleaning up after a days adventure a breeze.

During winter months this home is heated with hot water baseboard heat (it is very warm and cozy, but you will hear some noise as the hot water passes through the piping to heat the home)

Guest access
There basement apartment is below a 3 bed 1 bath home and a studio apartment that all host guests!

If you see other travels - say hello :)

Sypes Canyon
The "M" Trail
Middle Cottonwood
Hyalite (any hikes)
Drinking Horse
Galligator Trail
Lava Lake
Pete's Hill
Bear Canyon

Recommended Drinking Spots:
Feel free to take a growler or two to fill at one of our local craft breweries:

The Bozeman Brewing Company. This is a great place to go after a day on the mountain or the river. The patrons are local. The owners and employees are friends. The beer is outstanding.

Bridger Brewing is across town on campus and also one of our favorites. The pizza at Bridger Brewing is excellent.

MAP brewing is a great place to have a beer.

The dive bars are The Filler, The Eagles, The Crystal, and The Hauf. Each often feature live music. The Hauf has live music nightly.

Plonk and the Open Range feature outstanding mixed drinks, wine

host_about:
Hello fellow travelers!  My husband and I love to travel and we love to stay in Airbnb’s.  
We realized that this is the best way to stay so in 2018 we set up a home in Phoenix  (where we live) so that our kids and our grandkids could have a place to stay when they come visit.  We also have a home in Montana, which is where I am from.  Much of my family still lives in Bozeman so we set up our home away from so we wouldn’t wear out our welcome when we come to visit!  Our Bozeman abode is beautiful and is located in the heart of the town.    We are very glad to be able to share our home away from home airbnb’s with you!

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.98 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
description:
Aspen Brook is nestled in an Aspen and Spruce grove near Riverside Country Club. The club's tennis and pickle ball courts provide viewing entertainment off the rear deck, highlighted by the Bridger Range of the Rocky Mountains. A brook with a foot bridge flows between the deck and courts.

This unique offering features two master suites with large bathrooms and walk-ins, along with a third bedroom. The living room boasts a spectacular river rock gas fireplace and luxurious sectional.

The space
Convenience and comfort amenities include:
- The entire house is air conditioned for maximum comfort
- Wide range of kitchen appliances (coffee maker, French press, electric tea pot, crock pot, toaster and blender)
- Cardio equipment (stationary bike and rowing machine) located in the garage
- Laundry Room (new technology washer/dryer, iron and ironing board)
- All 3 bedrooms feature flat screens and surround sound
- Bath/showers
neighborhood_overview: Aspen Brook is minutes away from downtown Bozeman, Belgrade, and the Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (BZN).  Bridger Bowl Ski Area is 16 miles away and Big Sky Ski Resort is just under an hour drive away.

name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description: The "Fox Box" is a newly constructed guest house in downtown Bozeman, Montana. This two bedroom detached apartment has its own entrance & parking, a large deck with outdoor seating, a modern kitchen & dining area, a pleasant living room, comfortable bedrooms, & is fully furnished with all your needs for an extended stay, including a washer & dryer. The Fox Box is the perfect place to experience the vibes of downtown Bozeman while exploring southwestern Montana.
neighborhood_overview: Just a short stroll from downtown Bozeman where you can enjoy fantastic restaurants, explore art galleries, find sporting goods and mountain fashion, or walk Bozeman's "Main Street to the Mountains" trails.
host_about: Usually traveling for work to Portland. I live in Bozeman, Montana.

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Brand new! Walking distance (5 blocks) to Main Street in Bozeman's Northeast Neighborhood. Walk to bars, restaurants, and shops. 4 blocks to the Gallatin County Fairgrounds, ice house, and carpool/shuttle lot to nearby Bridger Bowl. 2 miles to MSU campus. Very clean, comfortable, and well lit. Full and stocked kitchen. Washer and dryer. Queen sized comfortable bed. Full sized American Leather sofa bed (trust me, it's amazing!). Roku TV and WiFi.

The space
Brand new apartment above a garage. We live in the house on the property. The house is currently under construction, so unfortunately the yard is a mess but you won't know it from inside the apartment! We infrequently access the garage. You will need to climb stairs to get to the unit. Very quiet and private! There is plenty of street parking, and you are welcome to park in our driveway for loading and unloading. We are also happy to help you store your gear so that it's safe and out of the way!
neighborhood_overview: We are 5 blocks from downtown Bozeman, close to breweries, cafes, restaurants, and shops. Northeast Bozeman is a great neighborhood that features several parks and hidden gems away from Main Street (including Bozeman Brewing Company!). If you feel like taking a hike, Peet's hill, The M trail, and Drinking Horse trail are all easy to access after a short drive.

name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Be our guest in our downtown guesthouse! Just 6 blocks to Main Street and downtown Bozeman, our second-story guesthouse has everything you need to enjoy a night or a week in Bozeman. Perfect for a couple, this architect-designed, open-concept studio features radiant floor heating, a full-size bathtub, a washer and dryer, dishwasher, and a 300 sq ft second story outdoor patio. We are pet friendly (with a fee). Your private backyard space is fenced in and features a charcoal grill.

The space
The guesthouse is a second-story apartment above our downtown Bozeman garage. It's detached from the main house, where we live with our daughter and two dogs. This 600 square foot studio is perfect for a couple or a couple with 1 or two children. Inside you'll find a queen-size bed and a pull-out Queen sofa bed, a bathroom complete with a full-size tub and shower and a washer/dryer, a living room with a 50" smart television, a dining area, bar seating at the kitchen, a dish
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood is where you want to be in Bozeman. A 15-minute walk or a 5-minute bike ride will get you to every restaurant, shop, or brewery you need to see while you're in Bozeman:
Dave's Sushi, the Coop downtown, Montana Ale Works, Bozeman Brewing Comany, Wild Crumb bakery, Fink's Deli, the Emerson Center for Arts & Culture, Seven Sushi, Wildrye Distillery, Dean's Zesty Booch, Hey Day, Hattie Rex, Ted' Montana Grill, Plonk cocktails, the Bacchus Pub, and Chalet Sports.

If you're heading up to ski at Bridger Bowl, we're on the way. Swing by The Daily Coffee Bar for a latte and a breakfast burrito on your way.

There's plenty of on-street parking in our neighborhood. It's both safe and quiet while still being close to everything.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Cottage in Bozeman · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
description:
Enjoy this cozy 2 bedroom, 2 bath house with a large finished basement to yourself in a prime downtown location. A short walking distance to Dave's Sushi, Main St., Wild Crumb Bakery and more. This charming house has a great feel with lots of custom features in a quiet neighborhood. Rest up with a great night's sleep in a beautifully remodeled and quiet home with tall, lofted ceilings. Enjoy coffee/tea in the relaxing private back yard or take a stroll to Bozeman's lively downtown.

The space
There is one bedroom with a queen bed and a small bedroom with a single bed. The upstairs bathroom is equipped with a small clawfoot tub. The large finished basement boasts a cozy TV room, full bathroom with comfortable shower, and laundry facilities. You have a long private driveway to park in that can fit multiple cars and/or RV, camper, etc.

Great access to: Biel Park, Community Food Co-op, MSU, bus stop, Main St., popular bars, amazing restaurants and numer
neighborhood_overview: We are just a block and a half from Bozeman's favorite and most popular sushi restaurant, Dave's Sushi.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Enjoy this beautifully restored, one-bedroom, fully-furnished apartment within a house, with its own private entrance. Located in a quiet neighborhood, just a 6 min walk north of Main Street and an 8 min walk to Wild Crumb bakery.

Fully-equipped kitchen with stainless fridge, gas stove, dishwasher, woodblock countertop. Dining room table seats six. High speed wifi. Free onsite parking. Washer/dryer. Great space for reading and relaxing. Wooden floors with Moroccan rugs.

License #: STR22-00057

The space
Perfect for 1 or 2 people.

Guest access
You'll have exclusive access to the entire 1 BR/1BA apartment, which is the front half of the house. You'll have your own private entrance, your own kitchen, living room, dining area, bedroom, bathroom, and washer/dryer.
neighborhood_overview: Amazing location: a five minute walk to Wild Crumb Bakery and Treeline Coffee, and mere steps from Mountains Walking and Bozeman Brewing. Endless trails nearby for walking, jogging, and biking. 20 min drive to Bridger Bowl and Crosscut Nordic Center.
host_about: Hello! I've been an airbnb host and traveler for many years. What I love most about Bozeman is the community... and of course enjoying the snow, hot springs, documentary films, great coffee, and tasty beer.

name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.77 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown, or walking distance to Montana State University.

The space
Guests have a separate side entrance to their private guest area in the daylight basement of our bungalow.
Upon entry from the driveway there is a locked door on the right to the host’s private kitchen on the main floor.

On the guest level there are Two Bedrooms separated by a shared Living Room with a couch, large comfy chair, desk with chair, cafe style dinette table and stools.
Each guest room has a secured lock and key.

The
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
description:
The townhouse-style home was built in the 70's and was recently renovated with new floors, kitchen, and bathrooms.

It features:

-A large master bedroom which is lofted (partially open) over the living room.
-Private balcony off the master
-Guest bedroom with a queen bed
-Upstairs full bath with tub
-Downstairs full bath with shower
-Open-plan living room and renovated chef's kitchen
-Laundry room in unit
-Electric sauna
-Semi-private outdoor space with grill and dining area

Permit 316716

The space
The home was recently renovated and was decorated with your comfort in mind. It has oodles of period charm and is furnished with vintage and found objects. Snuggle down in high-quality bedding and cushy furniture. We think it's a great place to be in all seasons, but it's particularly cozy on a snowy day.

You'll enter into the open-plan living room (hello, velvet sofa), which flows
neighborhood_overview:
The loft is located on the historic south side of Bozeman. It's nestled in a residential community of professionals and students, right around the corner from a park with a playground. It's also:

-5-minute walk to restaurants, a coffee shop, a convenience store, and more
-5-minute walk to the Galligator Trail, the old railway trail that connects Montana State with downtown
-10-minute walk to Museum of the Rockies
-15-minute walk to Bobcat Stadium and 20 minutes to the center of the MSU Campus
-One mile to downtown Bozeman

name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Second story apartment with large deck and living space. 5 minute walk to downtown shops and restaurants. We are about an hour and a half to two hours from two entrances to Yellowstone National Park. Private parking space and entrance off of the alley. This unit has a full bathroom, full queen bedroom, and kitchenette. The living room also includes a pull out couch. The owners live in the downstairs portion of the house with their two friendly dogs.

The space
The guest suite is the entire second story of our house. Great for a couple or solo traveler. There is a private entry off of the alley with off street parking for two cars. The deck is great for hanging out on a sunny day and the main living space is nice and open lots of natural light, a sofa bed, smart tv (no cable) and fast and reliable wifi. The kitchenette includes a full fridge, two burner hot plate with basic cooking equipment, microwave, toaster oven and coffee maker. *NO STOVE/OVEN* We live do
neighborhood_overview: 5 minute walk to downtown Bozeman or the midtown area on 7th Ave.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
description:
Free, fast WiFi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in. Central AC.

The space
Managed by Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals, the longest running vacation rental company in town. Edge of town location and the nicest Legends unit available. High end living with radiant heat floors, great natural lighting, leather furniture, new flat screen TV with cable, wireless, gas fireplace & bbq, and a huge garage.

Legends Luxury Townhouse is managed by Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals, a small homegrown Bozeman company with over 20 years of experience. For more reviews and information, including a self-guided 3D walkthrough, search the name of the house plus the words Bozeman Cottage.

This townhouse in Legend's on Bridger Creek development was built in 2011 and beautifully finished - confirmed by our reviews. Located in a quiet neighborhood just 2 miles north of downtown Bozeman, you can enjoy the space, creekside trails, views and stars
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Garden Guesthouse in Bozeman's best neighborhood. Walking distance to downtown. Two blocks away from Bozeman Brewing and Mountains Walking Brewery. Right across the street from Wild Crumb Bakery (best bakery EVER) and Fink's Deli . 20 minute drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort so that you can have first tracks! The neighborhood is amazing and authentic. Experience Bozeman like a local.

We have a garden and 4 chickens on the property. They will say hello, you have been warned!

The space
The guesthouse is funky, comfortable and clean. The open kitchen and living space is great for relaxing after a day on the river or slopes. The bedroom is peaceful and full of storage.

Guest access
Find the boot and head into the backyard. The entrance is along the side of the house attached to the garage. A lock box with a key is mounted outside the door. The code will be provided after booking.

Other things to note
The un
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman's Northside neighborhood has character and attracts local businesses. The best breweries, bakeries, and restaurants around every corner.   The area is quickly transforming into the Arts District. Lots to do right out the front door.
host_about:
Hello there, my name is Emily :)
I live with my partner, Ben.

We love to climb mountains, ski & snowboard, go fishing and get outside as much as we can. Bozeman has access to endless amounts of outdoor recreation, which is one of the main reasons we both ended up in this mountain town.

We are both in the hospitality industry. Ben is a product designer and I am in marketing. 

We are passionate about becoming great hosts and sharing the place that we call home. Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.94 · 4 bedrooms · 7 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
Come stay in our brand new 2020 home just minutes from Montana State University. With room for the whole family, you'll enjoy the comforts of home and live like a Bozeman local. We are Montana natives and pride ourselves on offering you the best Airbnb experience possible. Reach out with any questions at all. We are super hosts and the property is family owned and operated. Need a car? Ask about our minivan on Turo. Let us show you our 5 star hospitality.

The space
As a software engineer and inventor, your host Lisa has had a ton of fun setting up the space with smart home gadgets. Bedside lights can change colors and turn on and off with your voice. There is an Alexa in every bedroom, an iRobot vacuum, smart shades, 55" The Frame Samsung television with ambient sensors to showcase Montana photography, and a smart lock to enter the space contact-free over bluetooth. This is a brand new build - everything is new.

Guest access
Entire 5-bedroo
neighborhood_overview: Our space is part of the Southbridge Neighborhood in Bozeman right off 19th avenue and very close to Montana State University. It's quiet and very walkable. Lined by wheat fields and gorgeous mountain views from all directions. It's a family friendly neighborhood. We have 4 kiddos ourselves and it's perfect for evening strolls and bike rides yet about 15 minutes to down town.
host_about: Born and raised in Helena, Montana I spent the majority of my life in the big sky state before heading off to college. My sister and brother and their families all are in Bozeman and my parents too. Montana is family and we can't wait to welcome you into ours.

Recommended Drinking Spots:
Feel free to take a growler or two to fill at one of our local craft breweries:

The Bozeman Brewing Company. This is a great place to go after a day on the mountain or the river. The patrons are local. The owners and employees are friends. The beer is outstanding.

Bridger Brewing is across town on campus and also one of our favorites. The pizza at Bridger Brewing is excellent.

MAP brewing is a great place to have a beer.

The dive bars are The Filler, The Eagles, The Crystal, and The Hauf. Each often feature live music. The Hauf has live music nightly.

Plonk and the Open Range feature outstanding mixed drinks, wine and beer imports.

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Enjoy downtown Bozeman and beyond in this beautiful and cozy Montana Mid-Century Modern condo, a conveniently located, brand-new 2020 construction only one block from Main! Perfect for couples or the single traveler, you'll have a reserved parking space, a fully-equipped kitchen, high speed WiFi, cable/smart TV, a private balcony to enjoy your morning coffee, convenient 24-7 keyless access from your phone (or a code), and many more amenities as described below. We look forward to welcoming you!

The space
This beautifully decorated, immaculate 650 sq ft unit is located in the south-east corner of the building, ensuring gorgeous sunrises and lots of natural light throughout the day. Enter the secured building with a wave of your phone via the Latch mobile app, or a private access code (also used to enter unit). In addition to the staircase, there is an elevator to assist you upstairs with your skis/snowboards, fly-rods, or any other gear along for the ride.
<
neighborhood_overview:
During your stay, you will be conveniently located in the heart of Bozeman.

Social life can be found less than a block to the north at Bozeman’s legendary “Barmuda Triangle”, a favorite collection of three unique drinking establishments popular among locals and visitors alike - the Molly Brown, the Scoop Bar, and the Haufbrau. (As an aside - the condo sits at the opposite side of the building as this area, so you won’t hear any noises from the famous “Triangle”. Just another perk of this particular unit!).

Also within a stone’s throw north, you can grab a bagel at Bagelworks, a cold treat from Sweet Peaks Ice Cream, or hit up Maven’s Market for some quality cheese and wine.

A few blocks west of the building you will find the Bozeman Co-Op, which offers a host of local and organic groceries in addition to a very popular soup, salad, and entrée buffet. Here you will also find a fine sampling of local beers and wine. If you're in the mood for delicious
host_about:
Ambrose is a front-end web developer, video game developer, and short-story writer. Jill is a software engineer, a violinist for the Bozeman Symphony Orchestra, a private math tutor, and fluent German speaker. We both love meeting new people and sharing the beauty of Bozeman.

As guests, we are respectful of the space, clean and tidy, laid back, and polite. We love exploring new areas,  eating at exotic restaurants, and learning about the local history and architecture. Being hosts ourselves, we are mindful of what goes into hosting and want to make things as easy and pleasant as possible for all parties.

name: Home in Bozeman · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
description:
Beautifully renovated 3 level 3Bd​/​3Ba + Office modern home minutes from Main Street.

Tucked into a quiet culdasac just 8 blocks south of charming Downtown Bozeman​,​ you’ll feel like you are far from it all on 1​/​3 of an acre with direct access to the popular Gallagator trail. host_about: We are both avid travelers and have lived, worked, studied and guided others through Latin America. We met doing what we love, backpacking in the mountains of southern Patagonia, and now make our permanent home base in Bozeman, Montana. We maintain deep connections to the Dominican Republic. Our daughters are 10 and love animals , so always vote to stay where there might be horses, goats, dogs and cats to meet.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.75 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
3 Bedroom Nestled in Old Town Bozeman

The space
Bozeman Experience-‘The Little Red House’

Imagine retreating to ‘Old Town’ Montana with hints of the ‘Wild West’ but with a twist of the modern vibe. Original brick and hardwood floors take you back to Bozeman’s beginning when the town was first settled in 1864 as a stop on a mining trail to Virginia City. Whether coming to Bozeman to shut down and take in all the sites or planning to work remotely with a change of scenery, picture waking up to the view of fresh snowfall or to the luscious summer green while ending your day soaking in a clawfoot tub. With original character details that date back to 1884, you will surely appreciate the history of the ‘Little Red House’ located in the heart of downtown Bozeman and complete with thoughtful modern amenities.
Open the door to the rustically modern living room that comes equipped with a wood burning stove and desk area. The remastered kitchen and dining
host_about:
Dream MT Properties, formally "Cozy Creek", is proud to be a small rental agency that gives special attention to its owners as well as guests. When planning your next trip to the Big Sky area, you will deal with very few people who understand what it takes to make a vacation great for your group coming in.  We pride ourselves in have a properties that are clean, well stocked, and in a great location.

Not only are we a small company that delivers one on one customer service, we also love giving free advice on where to eat, hike, ski, fish, play and sight see while you are visiting.

Enjoy being steps from the vibrant downtown scene, and exceptionally close to Bridger Bowl ski area, as well as favorite hiking areas. Enjoy Gorgeous views of the Bridgers!

The space
The bedroom has a Queen-size bed and the family room has a nice couch that pulls out to become a full-size bed; it's big enough for one adult or 2 small children.

Guest access

name: Camper/RV in Bozeman · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Welcome to the Trailer Glamper of Story Hills. The best feature of our 33 ft trailer is the location. Our property is 3 acres of mountain views and one mile from downtown. It’s a short walk to local coffee shops, breweries, etc. Access Bozeman's trail system from our gate; Bridger Bowl is 20 minutes away and MSU is 15 minutes by bike. We have the best of all worlds, a country feel, the amenities of a city, and easy access to wilderness adventures.

The space
In addition to all the full ammenities of the trailer, you have access to an outdoor BBQ, firepit, and washer & dryer. There is ample parking and you are welcome to interact with all of our animals as you wish. (We own two horses, one old barn cat, and lab-mix that loves to fetch.)
neighborhood_overview: We live in the ecclectic and unique Northeast side of Bozeman.  Its not trendy but is well known for the Wild Crumb Bakery, Mountains Walking Brewery, Fink's Deli and other local food trucks. The Story Mill Community Park is just outside our back gate and links you to an amazing trail system that takes you to the Bridger Mountains. Beautiful, historic, downtown Bozeman is one walkable mile away.
host_about: We have lived in Bozeman since 1991; married in 1998; and have owned this property since 2002. This is the place our three kids call home with space enough to ride horses, build snow forts and ski jumps, have huge backyard BBQ's and bonfires. Troy comes from an entrepreneurial background including the fitness business, film industry, insurance, and communication coaching. Lei-Anna has been in public education and currently consults with and travels to school districts around the country. We have a deep love and respect for the wilderness that surrounds us, the Greater Yellowstone, in addition to exercise, meditation, and a belief in a healthy organic and sustainable lifestyle.

A vibrant reimagining of an old-school hotel, the RSVP’s interiors are awash with a trendy boutique flair that draws inspiration from the property’s Big Sky environs. Relax poolside in the warmer months while enjoying some suds and locally sourced cuisine from RSVP’s very own restaurant The Farmer’s Daughters Cafe and Eatery.

The space
An intimate retreat awaits you in this queen room because sometimes a single queen bed is all you need. Get cozy in comfort surrounded by a style that is both global and local, pulling pieces from Montana and beyond for an upscale vibe that will make you feel right at home. These rooms are the smallest on the property (100 sqft), hence the price.

This cozy space is a perfect eat, sleep, play location in the heart of Bozeman. Walkable to downtown with breweries, eateries, music and shops just a few blocks from the front door!

The space
This is a 350 square foot studio space that is attached to our main home that is the perfect crash pad for someone passing through or staying to adventure around town.

This space has a small kitchenette with sink, a mini fridge, 2 stove top burners, toaster and microwave. There is a pub table and chairs and a queen size bed.

The bathroom has a smaller stand up shower with vanity and toilet.

This is the perfect place to lay your head after adventuring all day.

Guest access
This studio unit shares 1 wall with our primary home. Our home was built in 1960 and you will be able to hear some of the action in the main living space! We provide a white noise maker to help mitigate noise travel.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.86 · 4 bedrooms · 8 beds · 2 baths
description:
Here in the Heart of Bozeman life can be whatever you want: quiet and simple or exciting and adventurous--all in the same day!
Whether you're on vacation or working in the valley, we've outfitted our home to be YOUR home while you're here. We are excited to welcome you to Bozeman, and to invite you to enjoy all this beautiful area has to offer!

The space
Get to know our community from this beautiful vacation home, which easily and comfortably sleeps up to 14 people. It's the perfect place from which to begin your adventures, whether you're staying in the city of Bozeman or venturing further afield to explore southwestern Montana!
After a busy day in the Gallatin Valley, enjoy one of Bozeman's dozens of restaurants or come home to a spacious, fully equipped kitchen or the grill out on your private patio and ply your chef skills. There are 7 grocery stores less than 5 minutes from the house, plus we provide a few items in the pantry--help yourself!
neighborhood_overview:
The Walton Homestead subdivision is a quiet and inviting neighborhood with a family-friendly atmosphere and views of the Bridger Mountains. The yard and an open space behind the house gives kids and four-legged friends a place to stretch their legs and there's a full park and playground less than one block away. (Note: the yard is NOT fenced.)
Being at almost the exact geographic center of Bozeman, you'll be minutes away from everything: shopping, groceries, fine dining, fast food, the Gallatin Valley Mall, gyms, hiking (at multiple regional parks within city limits,) coffee shops, bars, cinemas, live theater, music venues, spas and salons, bowling, the Bozeman Swim Center, the Bozeman Beach, churches, not to mention the real reason so many people want to visit Bozeman--the skiing, fishing, golfing, hiking, camping, climbing and dozens of other outdoor activities the people of this town love so much!

The space
Key Residence Features:
Downtown Bozeman | 30 day minimum stay required

View And Location:

host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

neighborhood_overview:
Flanders Mill is a newer neighborhood on the west side of town. Wide sidewalks welcome you to take a nice walk or jog. Take a lap to one of the many parks both in and around the neighborhood. The Gallatin County Regional park is just a block away with a large fenced in dog park, a couple lakes, a kid friendly playground and additional walking paths.

description:
Come stay a couple days or a couple weeks. Lots of space indoors and out. Beautiful views of the mountains, big skies and urban open spaces. Magnificent sunrises and sunsets. Whether you are here to enjoy or here to work, this is the spot for you. We are nestled in a burb easily accessed from I90, but far enough away for peace and tranquility. The Streamline bus stop is just 3 blocks away for easy access to public transportation to downtown or other local destinations. License # STR21-00004

The space
Enjoy a restful night in our quiet neighborhood and bring your furry friends. Our home is located across the street from the neighborhood walking trail, park and wetlands. There are also basketball courts and a playground nearby.

The front porch is great for lounging, bird watching (song birds, ducks, geese and cranes), and taking in the sunrise over the Bridger Mountains. Or, jump on the trail for some exercise. The dirt trail is a 1.5 mile loop. Walk no
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in the northwest part of town. Our little burb is quite active. You'll see people walking, running or biking the trail all day. The playground is down our street 2 blocks to the south and the basketball courts are another 2 blocks past the basketball courts.

Don't worry if you forgot something at home. We have groceries, outdoor gear, beauty supplies, crafts, gaming, etc. within a 10 minute walk.

description:
Central AC, Free, fast 400 Meg Ultra Spectrum Wifi*** Keyless self check-in.

The space
Ideally located three blocks from historic main street, this newer modern condo has 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, and views of the Bridger Mountains. The Downtown Bozeman Birdhouse is managed by Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals, a small homegrown Bozeman company with over 20 years of experience. For more reviews and information.

Ticking all the boxes - location, style, size, amenities - this new listing is already a favorite!

When you walk in the front door, the tall ceilings, large windows, and concrete floors set the tone of a this stout home. The main floor is open with a back door to a bbq patio and semi-private rear entrance. The kitchen has granite and composite counter-tops and all the amenities from home. Prepare meals with ease as it comes fully equipped with new appliances and a great supply of cookware, dinnerware, spices and dry goods.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Our backyard studio is located on Bozeman’s iconic Willson Avenue, in the perfect downtown location. This cozy spot is perfect for an overnight stop, on your way to Yellowstone or Glacier National Parks, or a longer stay to enjoy all that Bozeman has to offer.

Summertime is heaven in Montana and our quiet studio offers a queen sized bed, a simple, but well stocked kitchen, including complimentary Starbucks coffee and a single bathroom with shower. Everything you need for an easy Bozeman vacay!

The space
Single room studio, with queen sized bed, simply-stocked kitchen including fridge space, Kuerig coffee machine and 4 burner stove, plus 3/4 bath and stacking washer & dryer. All the basic comforts available to make your stop easy and enjoyable.

Guest access
The studio has access to a shared common area backyard. There is a patio table with chairs, string lights and a charcoal grill available for guest use.
neighborhood_overview:
Our favorite restaurants & cocktail bars within easy walking distance:
Revelry
Sky Shed (Armory rooftop venue)
Nina’s Tacos
Blackbird Italian Kitchen
Dave’s Sushi
Plonk Wine Bar
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.90 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Modern Home in Valley West

The space
Book with Outwest Hideaway to sleep an additional two guests.

Dogs are considered with owner approval and a fee. Please inform us at the time of booking of the number and age/weight/breed of the dog(s) you are planning to bring.

BRIEF DESCRIPTION: Built in 2019 this townhome has been thoughtfully designed and is a great value for your Bozeman vacation or extended stay. A few miles from the home you will have Bozeman’s Main Street with a variety of great local restaurants. All three of the bedrooms are upstairs but on the main level you'll enjoy a chef's kitchen and an open concept living room and dining room. It's the perfect environment throughout all the seasons of Montana.

BEDROOMS/BATHS: The home has three bedrooms upstairs and a sitting room on the main floor with a sofa sleeper for flexible sleeping space. On the upstairs level, the master bedroom has a King size bed and en suite bathr

description:
The City Slicker - Luxury Townhome in Downtown Bozeman

The space
BRIEF DESCRIPTION: Nestled just a few blocks away from downtown Bozeman, this impeccable luxury townhome is a part of the new Wilson 16 development. Boasting 2,446 square feet of living space, the City Slicker is a lavish three-bedroom, three-bathroom townhome that can comfortably accommodate up to six guests. Its open floor plan is designed to provide a seamless flow of space, allowing you to make the most of its generous layout. The property features multiple decks, including one with breathtaking Bridger Range views, where you can unwind and soak up the outdoors.

BEDROOMS & BATHROOMS: This impressive home has three bedrooms, each with its own en-suite bathroom. The top floor hosts the true master suite, which is complete with a king bed, a private deck, and a luxurious bathroom with three vanities, a soaking tub, and a large steam shower with two shower heads. name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
description:
The Bozeman Retreat is just seven blocks from downtown and only a few blocks from midtown Bozeman. This new highly efficient contemporary home features a full kitchen, local TV, Roku, WiFi, stereo with Bluetooth, keyless entry, washer, dryer, coffee maker, filtered water, in-floor heat, new appliances, and welcoming decor. There is plenty of off-street parking and the retreat is easy to get to and from wherever your travels might take you.

The space
This private residence has character, lots of plants, and plenty of style. Guests enjoy their mornings on the balcony and maybe a soak in the clawfoot tub before bed.
neighborhood_overview: The Bozeman Retreat is in the 'old' or original part of Bozeman. Homes in this area are a mix of original homes that were built in the 1930's to new homes like the Retreat. There is an elementary school a few blocks to the west. Downtown is five to seven blocks away. Bozeman Midtown is a growing area and this is about five blocks away. The street is quite with really not much more traffic than residential.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Vaulted ceiling guesthouse apartment built in 2018, newly furnished with modern mountain decor. Enjoy open concept design, loft, custom finishes, personal and local decor throughout. Set in a quiet, north Bozeman neighborhood with views of the Bridger and Gallatin mountains. Sandan Park is across the street; trails along Cattail Creek lead to groceries, coffee shop, and award winning Outlaw Brewery. Excellent fit for a quiet get-away, adventure travelers, and those working remotely.

The space
Full kitchen and bath. Washer and dryer. Memory Foam queen bed with 100% cotton sheets and blackout curtains for those late summer Montana sunsets. High speed WiFi internet, Bluetooth tabletop speaker, Roku TV allows guests to log into their own accounts for Netflix, Apple TV, Amazon Prime Video, etc. Dedicated workspace desk and comfortable full size futon in loft.

Guest access
Reserved off street parking and coded access for ease and security.

description:
Adorable Downtown Bozeman Home

The space
** Security Deposit Required & 30 Night Minimum**

BRIEF DESCRIPTION: Step into the world of luxury and convenience with the Corner Cottage, a stunning home located on North Tracy in Bozeman. Surrounded by charming neighborhoods, this spacious abode offers a quiet and peaceful respite from the hustle and bustle of city life. With an expansive, fenced-in yard and a prime location within walking distance of downtown, the historic Mill District, and the Cannery District, it's the perfect place to call home during your stay in Montana.

GENERAL LOCATION AND SETTING: The Corner Cottage is situated on a corner lot in a delightful residential neighborhood, and offers an abundance of off-street parking. Enjoy a stroll to one of the many nearby restaurants, bars, or even a brewery or distillery, all within a one-mile radius of your new home.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
description:
This bright and airy townhouse-style condo is located a short 5-10 minute drive to downtown Bozeman and Montana State University. Relax in your private bedroom and bath or enjoy complimentary tea or coffee on the back patio overlooking the beautiful open space with meandering creek.

The space
The space is a two-level townhouse style condo located on a quiet street with a secluded shared backyard open space.

Located on the main level are the living area, dining room, half bath, and well-stocked kitchen. The stairs off of the entryway lead to the second level where your private bedroom and bathroom are located. My rarely used home office and laundry room are located next to your room. The laundry room and bathroom have most amenities you may need for your stay, e.g. towels, body wash, detergent, iron, etc.

My room and bathroom are located down the hall towards the front of the house. Maggie, my 18-year-old cat, stays in my room sleeping
host_about:
Hi, I'm Sarah!  I'm a born and raised Alaskan and love everything outdoors, rain, snow, or shine.  I've lived in Bozeman for the better part of a decade so needless to say I'm a wealth of information for all of the best spots.  

I've worked in the service industry for many years and pride myself on being a good host, whether its giving you your space or pointing you in the direction of the best dining experiences, outdoor recreating spots, or community activity.

I'm a low-key traveler who occasionally has a dog in tow.  I love crossword puzzles, mornings, Italian wine, and food.  And climbing.  And running.  Also, animals and puns.
