name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Central AC, fast WiFi. *** EV 220-volt charging port! Keyless self check-in. Not suitable for children under 8 years of age.

The space
Located just 5 blocks from downtown Bozeman and right alongside Bozeman Creek, this brand new home is already delivering quality experiences! Modern, efficient designing created this unique 3-story gem which is occupied half the year by the owner. Central AC cools all floors including the main/upper floor where the living room and kitchen are located.

The living space on the 3rd floor gets drenched in sunlight and has floor to ceiling windows. The stream-side patio door opens a large section of wall to the cottonwood trees with creek running right below. The back yard is directly alongside the stream and in the shade of the large trees.

Above the living room level is another loft area with an incredible perched work space, and outside of that is a 4th floor deck with a stock tank hot water bath tub, bbq gr
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.69 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown or Montana State University.
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 2.5 baths
description: Unwind by a sleek gas fireplace after an active day in big sky country. Timber floors and framed images of nature are reminders of the rustic location of this contemporary townhouse. Cook in a chef's kitchen and let kids sleep in a room of bunk beds.
host_about: 10 years ago I moved to beautiful Bozeman, Montana. I instantly fell in love with the Mountains that surround Bozeman and all that they have to offer. In the summer, you can find me exploring a new hiking trail with my kids and in the winter, we will be on the slopes either at Bridger Bowl or Big Sky. I travel frequently for my job so I rent out my home while I am gone. I also have the privilege of helping my mom rent out her home next door while she spends part of the year in Texas.

name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Stay in the heart of Bozeman! Walking distance to Main St (10 min) & MSU Campus (5 min). Spacious upstairs apartment with A/C throughout & newly refinished historic wood floors. Located in a beautiful historical neighborhood lined with mature trees and several parks within 3 blocks.

The space
You have your own separate entrance to this second floor apartment. Entrance to the apartment is located on the front porch of our home.

The wood floors of the apartment were recently refinished.

The first room you enter has a queen bed, couch and work desk. This room is equipped with a window A/C unit. There is a walk in closet just inside the front door for hanging clothes and storing bags.

The next room you walk into is the living and dining room with couch. Filled with lots of light from the 3 bay windows, this is our favorite room! The room is equipped with a portable (free standing) A/C & heat unit and a Samsung Frame 65" TV.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Welcome to Bozeman MT where skiing, fishing, hiking, and Yellowstone National Park are at your fingertips. And if you are staying in Bozeman then why not stay steps from where all the buzz happens? Our 1 bedroom with a king size bed, a Murphy pullout in the living room, and 1 bath house is located 3 blocks from the center of downtown. Perfect for a couple or a traveling family. We are just steps away from restaurants, boutiques, coffee shops, theaters, and great bars.

The space
Guests will have access to the entire property. Your space has 1 bedroom with a king size bed and a queen pull out Murphy bed. There’s 1 full bath with washer and dryer. The kitchen is fully stocked if you like to cook but you are also a quick 3 blocks from all of Bozeman’s yummy food options.
Have a bigger group? We have another rental right next door that is a 2 bedroom 1 bath. *NEED MORE SPACE! ASK US ABOUT OUR 2 BEDROOM RENTAL NEXT DOOR!*

Guest access
G
neighborhood_overview: When visiting Bozeman there really is no better place to stay then right in the heart of downtown. Your house is 3 blocks away to the center of the downtown. There are so many great restaurants, boutiques, art galleries, coffee shops, beauty, and nightlife right around the corner from your location on Main Street. Nine blocks the other way gives you access to the shuttle that will take you directly to the ski area at Bridger Bowl.  You will also find a big park located just a block away. Whether you are here for the skiing, hiking, fishing, or visit to Yellowstone you will find our location a great base area for all your fun!
host_about: Tommy and I are a young couple that both grew up in the area.  We enjoy traveling and meeting new people along the way.  When we aren't exploring the world we are in our hometown enjoying the scenery. Private studio guesthouse with kitchenette and cozy loft. Great downtown location: 3 blocks to main street, 2 blocks from public outdoor pool, 1 block from town trail system. Walkable to library, restaurants, coffee shops, farmer’s market, grocery, cross country skiing trails, and MSU. Freestanding cottage on quiet alley.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
description:
Prime Downtown Location -- Free, fast Spectrum Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs --- Keyless self check-in. Heated floors throughout.

The space
Ideally located three blocks from historic main street, this beautiful newer Spanish style home has views of the Bridger Mountains and is kitty corner from a large city park. The Downtown Villa is managed by Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals, a small homegrown Bozeman company with over 20 years of experience. For more reviews and information.

Ticking all the boxes - location, style, size, amenities - this new listing is already a favorite!

When you walk in the front door, the high ceilings, large windows, and concrete floors set the tone of a quiet, solid-build home. The main floor is open with two doors to the outside courtyard complete with shade trees, a bbq and plenty of outdoor furniture in summer. The kitchen has granite and composite counter-tops and all the amenities from home.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
description:
Private and modern one bedroom, 1.5 bath home.

This home is situated 4 blocks from Main St in Bozeman’s historic Brewery District. You can walk a few blocks to an energetic downtown Bozeman, and have a peaceful retreat to return to. Or drive a short distance into the mountains for amazing hiking, biking, and skiing. The options are endless, and you have the best of everything in this location.

The space
Northeast Bozeman has a unique artistic flair, and each home and business in the neighborhood is a thread in a living tapestry. We are happy to share this special place with you.

Enjoy your stay with the private firepit patio, modern designed living space, full kitchen, and large walk-in tiled shower. Store your skis in the on-site secured shed. Take our bikes for a spin around the neighborhood or downtown. Park your car (or two) in the private parking and walk or bike to:
- Coffee: Wild Crumb, Treeline Coffee, Café M
- Live mu
neighborhood_overview:
Bozeman's eclectic northside, near downtown - this neighborhood is in the established and gentrified older part of Bozeman.

Northeast Bozeman has a unique artistic flair, and each home and business in the neighborhood is a thread in a living tapestry. We are happy to share this special place with you.

The owners encourage you to stroll around! Walking the neighborhood you'll see fantastic art displays, wall murals, and even one of those quintessential Bozeman chairs, benches, or fences made from well-loved skis.
host_about:
Hi! 

I grew up in Bozeman and it's been my home for most of my life. I love this community and want every step I take to reflect the best I can offer it.

I enjoy fostering strong relationships with my owners and guests. A person’s home and investment is a very emotional space for many people and a respectful and honest relationship puts everyone at ease and allows us to do more.

I'm a father of two amazing kids. I enjoy hiking, snowboarding, DIY projects, and working on my business and myself.

Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located home, close to world class skiing at Big Sky, and minutes from local skiing at Bridger Bowl. Additionally, for the outdoor adventurist, there's white water rafting, hiking, mountain biking, fishing, hunting, and snow sports, all nearby. Yellowstone is about 80miles away, allowing for a daytrip to visit! Even better, we are located a short 10 min drive from the Bozeman Yellowstone Airport.
STR21-00048

Built in 2020 and beautifully appointed, this home is just minutes from downtown Bozeman. It's a great space to return to after your adventures outdoors! You'll enjoy relaxing in comfort in this fully equipped home. There are TWO suites, both with king sized beds, and private baths. A fully equipped kitchen allows for cooking in, OR carry out and chill in the family room while catching up on all of your favorite shows!

name: Cottage in Bozeman · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Enjoy this log home in Bozeman’s most soulful neighborhood. Walkable to the famous Wild Crumb Bakery, Treeline Cafe, Mountains Walking Brewery, and Downtown Bozeman. This 1940s traditional Montana cottage is the perfect retreat to experience life like a local. Backyard, private parking, and a safe neighborhood will help you rest easy at night.

The space
Our log home was built in 1940 and is as sturdy as it is unique - truly the essence of Montana. The downstairs bedroom offers a cozy queen bed and view of the backyard. Access to the upstairs bedroom does involve a moderately steep set of stairs, queen bed and a window overlooking our beautiful neighborhood.

The kitchen is stocked with cooking utensils and basic cooking essentials (salt, pepper, oil) as well as coffee and tea so you can enjoy cooking in for a crowd. If cooking isn't your passion, we're steps away from some of the best restaurants, breweries, and bars in town!

Other th
neighborhood_overview: We may be a bit biased, but we think our house boasts the absolute best location in all of Bozeman. Within a 5 minute walk of our home is an incredible bakery (Wild Crumb), the best coffee the city has to offer (Treeline), many great breweries, restaurants,  bars, the main street of town with cute shops, and trails galore webbing out from the Bozeman Public Library (yup,our library moonlights as a trailhead!) Despite being so close to everything,  the house is on an incredibly quiet street, nestled amongst other charming homes.
host_about:
Some numbers: In the (12) years I’ve been a member of the AirBnB community, I've stayed in over (100) AirBnBs across (6) continents, rented out (5) of my living spaces while traveling, and met my (1)  husband while staying in his AirBnB.  

To say I love this platform is an understatement.  It has fundamentally changed how I navigate the world and provides me with the freedom to see more of it.

I aim to be the best host you've ever had because I understand first hand how important accommodation is to a great experience on the road. 

I aim to be the best guest you've ever had because I understand how personal it is to open up your home to travelers.

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
*There is now a TV in the living room*

Stay in Central Bozeman on a budget at this private "Montana Modern" 2 bedroom condominium with king size master bed and twin over full bunk bed.

Condo is located on the ground level of the complex. There are upstairs and next door neighbors, so there can be some noise, although the walls block most of it. There is a free included outdoor parking spot, as well as unlimited street parking.

Enjoy our cozy hygge inspired living area and bedrooms!

The space
*There is now a TV in the living room*

This is a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom condo, but it is possible to sleep 5 people comfortably-- two in the master, two in the full, and one in the twin bunk bed.

For children: The hot water heater is semi exposed, and there is no door to close up the laundry area. There are lots of unique decorations we have collected, and they may not be suitable to small children due to choking hazards

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.90 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
Western Magic is a spacious condo with 3 bedrooms, a fully equipped remote office with standup desk, supplies, & printer, and a fully stocked kitchen - to make the most of your Bozeman getaway. Enjoy a covered front patio for entertaining and relaxing, and a back patio for grilling with a large gas grill. Located on the west edge of Bozeman, with views of the Bridgers and easy access to Big Sky or Bridger Bowl skiing, fly fishing, trails, downtown, and major stores. Family-friendly. No pets.

The space
Western Magic is a 2 story, spacious condo with high vaulted entrance way and lots of windows and natural light.  Three bedrooms are on the 2nd floor, with a queen bed in 2 rooms and a coiled spring full size futon mattress that pulls out from a couch in the 3rd room. The kitchen is FULLY stocked with everything you need to cook a feast on your getaway.  Enjoy a cozy gas fireplace, back patio with BBQ grill, nice back lawn, views of the Bridgers, and a spacious fro
neighborhood_overview: This is a suburban neighborhood on the west side of Bozeman, with plenty of green space and walking trails close by that you can walk to from the condo. There is a lovely park a block away with a kids play area, and 4 blocks away is a set of walking/biking trails around 2 small "lakes", a larger kids play area and a picnic pavilion. Look out for Osprey dive bombing for fish in these lakes! Yes, you can fish in them. The neighborhood is a mix of families, students, and professionals. Be sure to drive slowly on the streets and be alert as there are joyful young kids who play outside in the neighborhood.
host_about:
Adventure mom, strategic marketer, sustainability & geotourism advocate.  I have 2 homes I rent when I am not in them, in Western North Carolina and in Bozeman, Montana. I know the WNC area around Bryson City, Nantahala Gorge, Sylva, Cherokee and across the park into Gatlinburg very well.  I also know the Bozeman and Greater Yellowstone Valley quite well after more than a decade of living there. I am a keen skier - alpine, telemark, xc classic and xc skate  as well as a fly fisherwoman, hiker, and biker. I love to help others find the right adventure activities, and places to go and see, for your vacation success.  

Hiking, float trips, white water rafting, lake paddling, waterfalls, mountain biking trails, best roads for road biking, best motorcycle touring roads, best skiing and rivers to fish are all things I'd love to help you find! Am very kid-centric, so am happy to be a great resource for the best things to do with kids from tiny tots to adventure loving teens.  I run an adventure tourism and travel marketing agency, so helping others find big and small adventures in cool places is in my DNA.

description:
Launch your Bozeman adventure from this brand new 2 bedroom condo in mid-town Bozeman

The space
Your group will love spending time in this brand new (completed July 2021) 2 bedroom. The views from this corner condo are absolutely wonderful!
The owners have thought of everything to make your stay comfortable. The kitchen is stocked with everything you need to prepare meals. The coffee pot is a duo drip and Keurig system. We provide coffee essentials. Also in the kitchen, an Instant pot, blender, hand mixer, spice rack, coffee, teas, pots and pans.
The first bedroom features a large California king bed with high quality linens. The second bedroom is a queen. Both rooms have plenty of closet space.
The living area is a welcoming and eclectic blend of comfortable furniture. Stream your shows from the large Tv.

host_about:
Dream MT Properties, formally "Cozy Creek", is proud to be a small rental agency that gives special attention to its owners as well as guests. When planning your next trip to the Big Sky area, you will deal with very few people who understand what it takes to make a vacation great for your group coming in.  We pride ourselves in have a properties that are clean, well stocked, and in a great location.

Not only are we a small company that delivers one on one customer service, we also love giving free advice on where to eat, hike, ski, fish, play and sight see while you are visiting.

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.71 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
Bring the whole family (plus pet) for your basecamp in Bozeman. Ideally located near MSU, Yellowstone National Park and the airport for your work commute.

This spacious property offers an abundance of space for spreading your luggage out in each bedroom (3). A full kitchen is provided with use of pots, pans, Ninja blender, cast iron pans and more. High speed internet is included along with free parking.

The space
There are three spacious bedrooms on the second floor with 2 full baths. Downstairs you'll find plenty of room to cook in the kitchen downstairs and comfy seating for watching your favorite show in the evening.

The kitchen is loaded will all of the essentials to cook your local meal which include; cooking oil, basic spices, select condiments and more. Don't worry coffee and sugar is always supplied too. The bathrooms are also equipped with body wash, shampoo and conditioner.

Guest access
Guests have full acce
host_about: Avid outdoor enthusiast making the most out of exploring Montana and opening my doors to help you do the same! As a Bozeman resident for just over 3 years, originally hailing from the Great Lakes state of Michigan, I'm driven to put many miles in by foot, bike, skis and water ways. The state boasts incredible recreational opportunities with two spectacular National Parks and countless National Forests. Reach out as I'm always happy to recommend lovely meandering trails or delicious food around the area.

name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Base your Bozeman stay at our private, clean, cozy, bright, and convenient 2 queen bedroom/1 bath BASEMENT suite in our 1950s home near Downtown and MSU. We can host up to 4 guests. 2 desks, WiFi, 2 Smart Roku TVs, laundry, linens & toiletries. Efficient kitchen and dining area.
Off street parking and separate guest entrance with keypad.
Near restaurants, breweries, coffee shops and more!
Minutes to downtown 5, MSU 5, Bridger Bowl 25, Big Sky 55, BZN airport 20.
Bozeman Permit: STR21-00051

The space
This BASEMENT suite has a separate entry door with keypad lock. It includes 2 carpeted queen bedrooms, 1 bathroom with a shower and a small but well appointed kitchen (no oven) and a dining area - see photos.

Both bedrooms have large egress windows for good lighting and safety.

The suite is in our OLDER (1955) home so you should expect to hear squeaky floorboards and some sound from above as the hosts live and work upstairs
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet, safe, centrally located residential neighborhood with quick access to Downtown, MSU, the interstate and the airport.

Cooper Park and the MSU campus are just a short walk away.

Grocery: There are 3 grocery stores (Safeway, Albertsons, Town n Country) ~3/4 of a mile away and the Community Food Coop is a 12 min walk/2 min drive away.
Pharmacy: CVS, Safeway and Osco pharmacies are nearby if you need medications or incedentals.
host_about:
Sarah and I love living in Bozeman but also like to travel and adventure throughout the western US and the world, often on bikes. At home we spend our free time outdoors hiking, running, riding mountain and gravel bikes in the summer and nordic skiing, snow biking, and ice climbing in the winter. When traveling we prioritize exploration and adventures.

As hosts we welcome you and try hard to provide a clean, comfortable, convenient, and affordable base for your Bozeman visit and adventures. We are happy to share years of local knowledge about fun things to do in the Bozeman area including hiking, skiing, backpacking, ice climbing, mountain-biking, visiting Yellowstone National Park, and places to shop or eat around town.

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
description:
On Historic Main Street, this charming condo with alley access includes: a LED fireplace, granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, fully stocked kitchen, Smart TV with surround sound, at home work station, air exchange system bringing fresh air to the windowless basement, and pictures galore providing a picturesque motif of The Speak Easy Era. Be a local in Downtown Bozeman enjoying the luxury of walking to your favorite restaurant, coffee house, park, cultural center and music venues!

The space
Two bedrooms; one with twin beds and the other with one queen offer extra bedding and plenty of space to settle into with dressers and closet space for storage. Unit bathroom offers a shower and vanity with bathroom amenities for your convenience.
The common space in the entry way offers a public 1/2 bath and a laundry facility for your personal use.
The open floor plan includes a fully stocked kitchen, dining area, breakfast bar, a comfortable living
neighborhood_overview:
Be a local and walk from your new home in Historic Downtown Bozeman to the many sights, eateries, and museums lining Main Street: Jam Eatery, Tree Line Coffee, Emerson Cultural Center, Ellen Theater, Gallatin History Museum, Rialto Music Venue, Bozeman Food Co-op, LuLulemon, Country Book Shelf, Schnees Shoes, Black Bird Kitchen, Theory Hair Salon, The Market Place, Backcountry Burger Bar and The Bozeman Public Library. Bozeman is where new vogue culture meets legendary history. Take it all in by living in the heart of what John Bozeman found so intriguing years ago.

Ready for an adventure? Rent a bike from Owenhouse Cycling and ride from Downtown on the Gallagator Trail south to The Museum of the Rockies and meet the local dinosaurs! Next, cycle around Montana State University to see what all the hype is about!! Then back home through the south side neighborhoods looking for the Historical Register lawn signs telling the tales of the old houses along the tree lined stree
host_about:
Hi, 
Welcome to Bozeman where my husband and I have been in the hospitality industry for close to 40 years. We owned and operated a restaurant on Main Street and most recently host vacation rentals. It is truly our passion, and it is our goal to meet your expectations for your time in Bozeman. We know the area like the back of our hand and would be delighted to answer questions and guide you in the right direction:)
We look forward to hosting you in 
Montana’s Big Sky Country!

name: Home in Bozeman · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath
description:
This home provides a respite while giving you the opportunity to work, play and engage in all the amenities that Bozeman has to offer. Those amenities include but are not limited to dining, hiking, skiing( both downhill and cross country),a remote work location and an unlimited access to social and cultural events that are a part of this university community.

The space
About this home
Parkside living in a relatively new home, with easy access to everything a person could want. The location of this home makes it ideal for business travelers or one looking for a remote location from which to work.
This comfortable home is 8 min from downtown Bozeman, you are just 30 minutes (19 miles) from Bridger Bowl; 1 hour (49miles) from Big Sky Ski Resort and 1 ½ hours (88 miles) from Yellowstone National Park entrance in West Yellowstone.
This home
From the south facing porch on the front of the home you can drink coffee in the mornings, nap in the aft
neighborhood_overview: My home sits across from a quiet neighborhood park with plenty of play ground equipment and a covered pavilion to enjoy an outdoor picnic or hold a meeting with a few co-workers.  Besides the tables under the pavilion, there are tables through out the park.  A large set of swings sets off in the adjacent corner of the park.  A running creek skirts the park on the west side where dogs gravitate for a drink and children are drawn to play in the water. name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Newly built in 2017 and already a favorite since its first Winter in 2022. Remote work haven in prime location, free/fast WiFi. Keyless self check-in. Smart TV.

The space
Managed by Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals, the longest running vacation rental company in town, this sleek and cozy, free-standing one-bedroom apartment is nestled in the heart of Bozeman's coveted Northeast Neighborhood. Step out of the urban grind and into this quiet panacea, where productivity, fitness and free time flourish. This newer freestanding apartment is your enchanting 21st century basecamp. Perched in the trees over a garage, it's perfect for a single or couple. Built in 2017 on a quiet side street near downtown, it has modern appliances, cozy, in-floor heat and heat recovery ventilation for year-round filtered, fresh air.

The house has a queen bed, full kitchen, full bathroom, and brand new laundry facility. Sunlight abounds from the large south facing windows and the
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

Centrally located within short walking distance of coffee shops, bakery, deli, breweries and Main Street to the Mountains trails. Only five blocks to downtown Bozeman. Easy access to Bridger Canyon. Quiet neighborhood.

The space
This is a new cottage in a quiet neighborhood in Northeast Bozeman.
Deck off the bedroom upstairs has an outdoor couch and small table and chairs for lounging in the warmer months.
There is a shared fire-pit in front of the cottage.
Brand new queen size bed in upstairs bedroom with attached deck and peak views of the Bridgers. Custom built-in couch in living room is larger than a single bed for additional sleeping options.
The kitchen is not a full kitchen but has small fridge, microwave, two-burner flat top stove and sink with disposal. There is also a small freezer in the living
neighborhood_overview:
Northeast Bozeman is a sweet neighborhood close to downtown but relatively low traffic so also relatively quiet.
Northeast Bozeman has really grown lately with great coffee shops, the best bakery in town, the best deli in town and two breweries - all within a few blocks of the cottage.
Check out my Bozeman Guide for suggestions on eating, exploring and more!
host_about: I split my time between a small island in Puget Sound and Bozeman, Montana. I am an attorney with two adult children who are off exploring the world.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
This home is such a sweet spot. Watch the deer from the back porch. Close to town, but quietly located just outside of town within walking distance to the East Gallatin River. Peaceful location, with large trees and mountain vistas. 10 minutes to downtown historic district and international airport. Bring your fly fishing rods, skis, hiking boots, and be ready for a fun filled, memorable vacation. Also, within 1 hour to Big Sky and 2 hours to Yellowstone National Park.

The space
Stylish quiet space with great entertainment spaces. Lots of beautiful trees. You will love this! Offers newly renovated townhome with vaulted ceilings and great entertaining areas. Cozy living room, desk and work station, modern kitchen, open floor plan, 2 en-suite bedrooms, Separate den with 2 extra couches and TV, central air conditioning, washer and dryer, and 1 car attached garage space. Babbling creek year round. Located at Riverside Country Club.

Guest access<

description:
Bring family and friends to enjoy and experience a bohemian eclectic treasure just two and a half blocks south of downtown Bozeman. Free/fast Wi-Fi. Hot tub. Keyless self check-in.

The space
This 1908 historic home was entirely rebuilt from the inside out with a design that unleashes color, texture, decor and modern conveniences that is playful and relaxing. While the original wood floors were preserved, everything else in the home is new.

South Bozeman Betty is managed by the longest running local vacation rental management company in town, Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals. a small homegrown Bozeman company with over 20 years of experience. For more reviews and information, including a self-guided 3D walkthrough, search the name of the house plus the words Bozeman Cottage.

As you enter the home you may be surprised that it is much larger than it seems from the outside. There are two homes in one - the original house named “Betty” and the
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.56 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
Historic Home close to downtown Bozeman!

The space
BRIEF DESCRIPTION: Originally built by Henry C Cockrill, the property is located in the coveted Bon Ton District, only two blocks from the vibrant downtown area of Bozeman, Montana. Whether you are a family, a small group, or a couple looking for a romantic getaway, this home is perfect for you. With antique sinks and furniture, exposed brick, and charming wooden accents, you can enjoy a taste of Bozeman's rich past. Central air conditioning will be available for the summer of 2023, adding to the many desirable features of this stunning 1890s home.

BEDROOMS & BATHROOMS: The main floor of the house boasts a bedroom with a king size bed, while the upper level has three more bedrooms, including a master bedroom with a full size bed and a large private bathroom. The two remaining bedrooms have queen size beds and share a full bathroom with a claw foot tub and antique fixtures.

KITCHEN & DINING:

neighborhood_overview: Rural Bozeman
host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

Enjoy this Modern and Newly Built Cottage located 1.2 miles from downtown Bozeman with views of the Bridger Mountains.

Complete with 2 king bedrooms (each with en suite bathrooms), a stocked laundry room, spacious office for remote work, dining space for 6, cozy living room, fully equipped kitchen, and 2 outdoor patios with a fire-pit and grille. Come enjoy the mountain views and experience all Montana has to offer!

Our Modern Cottage is fully equipped to be your home-away-from-home. The kitchen includes brand new appliances, quartz countertops, everything you may need for cooking and dining. Enjoy your meals together around the dining room table or take it to the back patio for a BBQ next to the fire pit where you’ll be greeted with fantastic views!

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
Located 4 blocks off Bozeman’s Main Street, this basement unit is perfect for a quick overnight stop or budget-friendly Bozeman trip! Whether it’s a summer adventure, hiking and biking, or a winter getaway, catching time at local ski resorts, our rental is centrally located to enjoy whatever brings you to Bozeman.

We do have 3 units in our home, so we request if you choose to book this space you acknowledge our quiet hours from 10pm-8am. No parties please.

The space
Our home has 3 separate units and we live on-site. This is the basement unit, with an upstairs unit above it and there is a studio located on the back of the house. The unit fully separated from the other two, so you have private access and the unit all to yourself. This is an older home so there is some noise transfer between the upstairs and downstairs, but I do have the two rentals linked so it’s rare that there are guests in both units. We usually stay in the other and are conscientious
host_about: Bozeman local for 20 years, Montana native. Lover of the outdoors, travel and adventure. Love hosting fellow travels exploring our community and all the adventuring in the area. We live on-site so we are available if you need anything, but stay out of your way so you can enjoy your time. Looking forward to hosting you!

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
South Tracy Place is located in the historic district of downtown Bozeman with its century old homes. From your private entrance, enjoy the 5 block walk to downtown with all its amenities: Bistros, Breweries and Bars. Restaurants to please every pallet, from BBQ to gourmet. Coffee shops, theaters, galleries and summertime Music on Main and Farmers Market events. Walk Peets Hill, the Elm and Museum of the Rockies. Drive to Big Sky, Bridger Ski Mountain and Yellowstone Park.

The space
South Tracy Place has recently been renovated. Noise reduction materials were added to all ceilings to remove noise so you can enjoy your quiet privacy. There are two bedrooms (king and queen) with one bathroom, kitchen, dining area and livingroom with a private sitting area outside. The space is a walkout, daylight basement with full height ceilings and windows. A pack-n-play is always available with sheets and blanket, but the unit is not child proofed. description:
This is the private, condo unit in the heart of Bozeman. It’s only 5 minutes to downtown Bozeman and 5 minutes to MSU ( Montana state university) and is furnished with stylish and modern decor. With 3 bedroom and 2 full bathrooms, the space is used very nice.
Bridger Bowl sky resort is about 30 minutes away. Big sky is about an hour and Yellowstone is about 90 minutes to the West entrance and North entrance

The space
This is a Triplex with whole a condo apartment for each floor. This unit is the between floor . Two of the bedrooms share a full bathroom which is nice because it’s like there’s two master bedroom . The third bedroom can use the full bathroom that’s also accessed from the living area . There is not a dining table, the eating area is at the countertop island in the kitchen. There are stairs to get between to the second floor . The layout of the apartment is very nice and it is an efficient use of place.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
description:
You will be close to everything when you stay at this beautiful, centrally-located home in the heart of the Cooper Park neighborhood. You'll be just 1 block from the park and 6 blocks from MSU campus. The Main St. Co-op Store is 3 blocks away while Bozeman's Downtown District, with many shops, restaurants, bars, & art galleries, is a short 10-15 minute walk. Bridger Ski Area is a 25 minute drive, Big Sky just over 1 hour, and Yellowstone Park 1.5 hours. No smoking or parties allowed.

The space
The Waterman House is a completely restored two-story home built in 1890 by Bozeman pioneers Christopher & Catherine Waterman. The light-filled house has 9-10 foot ceilings, hardwood floors, and is furnished with Montana-made Mission style furniture, beautiful Persian rugs, and all new premium mattresses. The kitchen is stocked with everything you need to prepare meals and the dining room table will comfortably seat 8 people.

You will

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Enjoy your stay in Bozeman with this comfortable home in easy walking distance to downtown. Just 3 blocks to downtown Main Street with many restaurants and activities. There is a private, fully fenced portion of the yard for you and your pup to enjoy. Covered parking for one car in the carport and room for a second car in the driveway behind it. There are two bedrooms with queen beds and an additional queen sized pull out couch. Desk for working, and small exercise area.

The space
One bedroom and the sofa bed are on the main floor. The second bedroom is upstairs and requires using the spiral staircase for access. There is a seating area with TV on both floors. The kitchen, bathroom, and laundry are on the main floor. Accessing the house requires using a two step stairway between the laundry entrance and the rest of the main floor.

Other things to note
Please feel free to message me with questions!

We prefer staying in houses over hotels when we travel and I've tried to think of everything I might want during a stay for our listing.

Whether it is after a long summer day of hiking and fishing or a day of skiing at Bridger Bowl or Big Sky, our home is just what you'll need to come home to and relax.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Welcome to your home in downtown Bozeman! This 3-bedroom, 1,500 sq. foot house has been our home for 16 years and we are excited to now share it with guests and visitors to Bozeman. This is as close to downtown a single-family home can be. Only two blocks to Main Street and 100 yards to Dave’s Sushi. This home was built in 1918 and the second story was added in 2002. The open, spacious downstairs living area is the perfect place to call home while you explore all that the Bozeman area offers.

The space
You enter into the open living room, dining room and kitchen of this charming and historic home. We love to cook and the kitchen is stocked with everything you'll need. There is one bedroom downstairs with an en suite bathroom, and a walk-in shower with skylight.

The stairs lead to the 2nd floor and two more bedrooms with a bathroom between them. The bedrooms upstairs are spacious with one containing a walk-in closet while the other has a small closet
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman's northeast neighborhood consists of charming and eclectic homes with easy access to downtown and great parks.
host_about: I moved to Bozeman in 2002 to ski-bum and...never left! I work for a Bozeman-based adventure travel company that plans trips to Yellowstone, Montana, and other beautiful natural places beyond. description:
3 Blocks from the core of Downtown Bozeman with central AC plus a separate studio space with kitchenette and bathroom. Nightly price ranges from 175/night I’m off season to 225/night summer and holiday season.

The space
Blue Hem is right on the edge of the downtown proper. This nice downtown property was built in 1984, adjacent to a lovely city park, and has a spacious fenced yard with deck and patio furniture.

The main house includes 2 bedrooms and 1.5 baths. There is a separate free-standing bonus studio in the back yard with a 3rd bedroom, kitchenette, and full bathroom with shower. This house has tons of custom finishes and beautiful lighting. It offers modern, comfortable furnishings. Perfect hangout with family and friends. The kitchen offers many amenities and tools to cook in if preferred. Large dining room table on sunny porch. Big screen TV with cable and Wifi included. Oversized master sweet offers a comfy king size bed with plenty of clos
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

Walking distance to the Co-op grocery store, Safeway, CVS, Feed Cafe, Roost Fried Chicken. Not far from downtown or 7th if you're catching some live music at The ELM or enjoying Music on Main or brunch at JAM! The three bedrooms include: a desk, bed, kimono robe, books on local hikes, and a blackout shades.

The space
This 2 level townhouse style condo is located near 19th and Main street in Bozeman. Upon entry, there is a powder room and hallway storage area - perfect for hats, gloves, coats, keys, bags.... The newly renovated kitchen features a gas stove, microwave, blender, crock pot, keurig and french press + plenty of tea stocked. The living space, also shared, is very spacious and has a ton of natural light. There are 2 barstools, a table for 4, and a gas fireplace. TV w/ ROKU downstairs is for shared use. Upst
neighborhood_overview: There are 4 grocery stores near by - Bozeman Co-op, Safeway, Town & Country, and Whole Foods. There are 2 gas stations, Roost Fried Chicken, Feed Cafe, The Hideaway near 19th & Main.

• Recently renovated chalet
• Sleeps 2 to 4 with queen bed & queen pullout sofa
• Full kitchen with breakfast bar
• Private bathroom with shower
• Dedicated workspace

and biking trails

• Book your escape and stay in this modern and homey chalet

Hosting Permit: STR23-00020

The space
Looking for a good quality accommodation in Bozeman, Montana that offers sleeping space for up to 4 guests?

Welcome to this modern and beautifully presented air-conditioned 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom mother-in-law apartment/chalet located above a detached garage in a quiet and conveniently located neighborhood.

Whether you're here for leisure or work purposes, there’s plenty of beau
neighborhood_overview:
This delightful Montana apartment for 4 is located in an upscale neighborhood of Bozeman. It’s a quiet and pleasant location that’s ideal for families or couples to escape to for a weekend, week, or longer, and for remote workers looking for somewhere to base themselves in Montana.

The property sits in the heart of walking & biking trails, parks, and all kinds of outdoor adventures, making it the perfect basecamp for getting out and seeing all that Bozeman and Montana have to offer on foot, bikes or by car.

Nearby places you might be interested in checking out during your stay include:

Yellowstone National Park - always a big attraction for people from all over the world with views, trails and landscapes you’ll remember for a lifetime.

Montana State University - the largest university in the state is close by, so if you’re a student or parents of a student looking to study here, the chalet is a great place to base yourselves while you’re chec
host_about:
I am a 30-something local resident of Bozeman, MT where I live and work as a VP at a digital transformation agency. 

I love traveling and spending time with my friends and family.  I enjoy all outdoor activities, hiking, backpacking, camping, fly fishing and watching football. 

Cheers!

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
description:
Spacious 1 bedroom condo on the west side of Bozeman. The condo is surrounded by parks with open space and water. Its fully equipped with kitchen, living room, private bedroom, 1.5 bathrooms, backyard, and indoor fireplace. There are 2 parking spaces in the driveway. The guests have access to the upstairs bedroom and full bathroom, and downstairs fully equipped living area, kitchen, and half bath with gas fireplace and large backyard with garden. There is a twin pullout in living area.

The space
Beautiful west Bozeman location with a private fenced in yard. The living area is equipped with entertainment, comfort, and gas fireplace. The bedroom has a queen bed and walk-in closet. There is a twin pullout in the living area for additional sleep space. The kitchen is fully stocked and ready for all cooking and coffee making. We do have heat and air conditioning for climate control. The backyard has a garden to enjoy including herbs and veggies during the summer

Come stay and play in this beautiful, stately cottage. Let yourself relax and sleep in luxury in one of two king suites, both offering a motel like experience with feather pillows and linens fit for a king. The master shower is an experience all its own and is perfect after a long day at the mountain or before a night out on the town.

For the traveler who must bring their laptop, there is an office just for you. Featuring a large adjustable desk, comfy business chair, and its own tv; this office is set up to make work just a little more enjoyable. neighborhood_overview: Gran Cielo is the manifestation of our dedication to create community through a common living space. While its million-dollar views, unmatched central park, and easy access to downtown Bozeman and the wild beyond make Gran Cielo an enticing location, it’s the sense of classic community that sets it apart. Whether you’re looking for your first home, a bit more space, or somewhere to settle indefinitely, Gran Cielo offers a sophisticated array of home types, sizes and styles. Unique architectural details and contemporary design draw residents in, but it’s the community’s centerpiece, a world class central park, that draws them together.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.73 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
description:
Originally built in the early 20th century this newly renovated, two-story, historical house is spacious, unique, and will make you feel right at home as you explore Bozeman. Centrally located within a mile of the MSU campus, a few blocks from the heart of downtown, and a 1-hour 45-minute drive to the west entrance of Yellowstone National Park, this 5 bedroom home is fit for the entire family on your visit to Montana.

The space
Two-floor home with 2 bedrooms containing queen-size beds, full bathroom, living room, kitchen, laundry on the first floor and 3 bedrooms (2 with queen beds, 1 with a twin bed) on the second floor.

Guest access
Guests have access to the entire unit, front yard, and paved patio between this home and the home next door.

Other things to note
The property is shared with residents who live in an attached unit (separate entrance).
neighborhood_overview: Located a short walk from the heart of Downtown, MSU Campus, and the up and coming Midtown district. Facing Main Street, the property is backed by quiet residential neighborhoods great for strolling and witnessing historical Bozeman.

description:
Our townhouse is close to downtown Bozeman, the airport, MSU and only 18 miles away from the Bridger Bowl Ski Area. City Hosting Permit Number STR22-00053

Other things to note
Please read the following before using the hot tub:

You are using the hot tub at your own risk

Pregnant women, persons with heart disease, diabetes or high blood pressure problems and elderly people should not use a hot tub or spa without a doctor’s permission.

We do not advise young children to use the hot tub. In the event that you allow a minor to use the hot tub, they must be supervised at all times.

Hot tub temperatures cannot by law exceed 104 degrees.

Never use a hot tub or spa alone.

Limit time in the hot tub or spa

description: This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit. We are in the center of Bozeman with  it's wonderful restaurants and amazing downtown. We look forward to you staying with us.

As a guest: Treating ones home as if it were my own, with respect.

The space

Say hello to Babcock Haven, a perfect home-away-from-home mere steps from the main drag of Downtown Bozeman. Heading out each day will be a breeze, as you can walk to restaurants, bars, cafes, and shops in no time. Outdoorsy activities abound year-round from hiking and biking to skiing and snowboarding at either Bridger Bowl (17 miles) or Big Sky Resort (50 miles).

Inside, highlights include a cozy living room with an accommodating dining area, a full kitchen, a private office, high-speed WiFi, and classic decor that will allow everyone to find comfort and relaxation. When it comes to entertainment, streaming favorite shows on the TV will be a blast and the young at heart will love heading downstairs to play a few games of foosball. description:
The space
Aspen Crossing

Quiet but still close to all the action, this apartment in downtown Bozeman has it all— a coffee shop, restaurant, and bar on the ground floor! The building has been renovated inside and out but still maintains the old-fashioned pizza parlor feel, complete with a game room that kids of all ages will enjoy. Aspen Crossing, a new development, includes restaurants, social areas, commercial and office space, and lovely accommodations. With Yellowstone National Park just a short drive away, you can live out your old west dream vacation here in this stylish place to lay your head. There's prime skiing at Big Sky resort, outlet shopping, and fantastic local eateries that you won't find anywhere else. Take a hike through the gorgeous green scenery and find all the natural beauty that Montana has to offer. Lindley Park Center is just two miles away and Bobcat Stadium is two-and-a-half miles away.

The Sweet Spot , located in beautiful Bozeman, Montana, is nestled 2 blocks from the hip and historic downtown. Take advantage of this spectacular location with world class recreation just outside your doors, truly the SWEET SPOT. Situated in the heart of this booming Montana town, you’re a quick walk to world class cuisine, shopping and 20 minutes from premier skiing. Enjoy this newly built duplex, with contemporary and stylish amenities. Welcome to Bozeman, "the most livable town."

The space
This inviting and modern 3 bedroom duplex is fully furnished with 1 king, 2 queen beds, and 1 full sized bunkbed. Each bed is adorned with soft linens and comfortable blankets. The 3 full baths are stocked with everything you need for your getaway, including hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, soaps, clean towels and more. The condo comes with a fully equipped kitchen that includes a stainless steel fridge, gas stove and Kurig coffee maker. The space also includes AC for the
neighborhood_overview:
Throughout the year, Bozeman is alive with activity. With festivals and outdoor concerts during the summer and endless outdoor summer and winter activities. Enjoy the being minutes away from the top fly fishing in the United States, ski hills, hiking trails, music events or the bustling downtown and get ready to explore! With downtown Bozeman minutes away (walking or driving), you are in the epicenter of Bozeman’s charm and can enjoy this booming little town and all it has to offer.

If you are looking to extend your adventures, you are just a short trip in any direction to the following:

21 min to Bridger Bowl Ski Mountain
90 min to Yellowstone National Park (Entrance)
30 min or less to the Gallatin, Yellowstone and Madison Rivers.
25 min to Livingston
50 min to Big Sky
15 min to Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.97 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
Enjoy a centrally-located, newly-built townhome in the heart of Bozeman. The house is in a very safe area of the city, with friendly neighbors all around, and a beautiful view of the Bridger mountains. Across the street from the house is a large plot of farm land, which makes for amazing sunset viewing from the front porch.

When we say "centrally located", we mean...

- 10mins from downtown
- 1.5hrs from Gardiner (Yellowstone North Entrance)
- 1hr from Big Sky
- 35mins from Bridger Bowl.

The space
The property has 3 bedrooms (1 King Bed, 1 Queen, and 2 Twins), and 2.5 bathrooms. There are 4 beds in total, 5 if you include the couch which can fold out into a full-sized bed. There is a half bathroom on the first floor, a full bathroom in the second floor hallway, and another full bathroom in the master bedroom.

Nothing perishable is provided to guests in the kitchen, but the room is fully supplied with kitchenware
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful little neighborhood located on the north side of Bozeman, about 1 mile from the freeway. Our neighborhood is filled with friendly people, a beautiful green, well-maintained park with a playground for kids. The drive to downtown is less than 10 minutes! We are in a well-populated area, so Ubers are typically an option, depending on the time of day.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Oh come to this home near where the buffalo roam, whether to work or as home base for play. Where seldom is heard a discouragin' word, and the fireplace is cozy all day.

This spacious, comfortable and well-appointed home in a quiet neighborhood is the perfect abode for your Bozeman visit. Located in the northwest area of Bozeman convenient to the airport, park trails, shopping, restaurants, and breweries. Only 15 minutes to downtown and 25 minutes to Bridger Bowl and Crosscut ski resorts .

The space
Decorated throughout with a wildlife theme, the home reflects its owner, a wildlife and Yellowstone ecology researcher and scientist.

The large open-concept living area features vaulted ceilings, a generous kitchen even a bison could easily fit in, large TV and gas fireplace.
The two bright and comfortable private bedrooms are across the hall from each other without shared walls, but do share the full private bathroom with tub/shower
neighborhood_overview: Convenient, friendly neighborhood with a park a large regional park just 3 blocks away with walking trails and ponds.
host_about:
Please call me Bob! I am the founder and chief scientist at the Yellowstone Ecological Research Center (YERC). Over my 30-plus years working in the Greater Yellowstone, my research interests have sought a more holistic connection between nature, people, and technology. That’s led to what I call “Adaptive Ecology,” studying not only how ecosystems adapt to changing conditions, but how the science of ecology must adapt to social and technological changes as well. That focus drives YERC’s mission today.

Personally, I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and finding common ground among cultures and communities.  I love sharing my knowledge of the Greater Yellowstone area and ecology, the best places to spot local wildlife, and my favorite watering holes in the area.

host_about:
Howdy! Welcome to Montana. I was born and raised on a working horse ranch in the heart of Paradise Valley, specifically Tom Miner Basin along the banks of the Yellowstone River. My parents continue to thrive on the ranch while my siblings and I went out into the world to pursue educations and other interests. My love for Montana brought me home in 2012, when I launched my vacation rental management business- MonTanya Yellowstone Properties & Concierge.

I'm based in Livingston and look forward to welcoming and accommodating you in southwest Montana.

The space
The cozy room in a serene urban arboretum will give you both privacy and access to the best of Bozeman.

Guest access
This listing is for a private room in the Lehrkind Garden House, a history property with a suite of trees and lush plantings. You will have access to your room (of course), the common areas in the building, a lovely covered deck with a picnic table as well as the lush grounds which are open for exploring.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. There's someone delicious available at most hours of the day.

Then, head back in time and visit the Museum of the Rockies, home to the world's largest collection of North American dinosaur fossils. Return home to relax on the patio by the fireplace and enjoy good company before heading inside and getting a good night’s sleep. The options are endless!

description: Find yourself surrounded by a lush summer garden or peaceful winter snow in this beautiful room with walk out private garden terrace. Sporting high ceilings from the completely new foundation supporting this fully renovated 1890 building, this room is cozy yet expansive. neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. There's someone delicious available at most hours of the day.

Stay within crawling distance to Sweet Pea and SLAM Festivals in this cozy, stylish basement hideaway nestled mere feet from beloved landmark parks, hiking trails, 360 mountains views, epic sunsets and of course Bozeman’s cherished Main Street with its eclectic restaurants, pubs, boutiques and year-round community events. Outdoor enthusiasts, families, bohemian city dwellers, foodies, traveling professionals, dog lovers and the like. Quintessential Bozeman is right outside your doorstep!

The space
Welcome to our home, ‘Peets Hideaway’, a comfortable and stylish basement apartment nestled in the quiet but bustling neighborhood of Bozeman's southeast side where the absolute best of Bozeman - the quintessential heart of Bozeman - awaits right beyond your doorstep.

We are born and raised, longtime Bozeman residents who are thrilled to offer you the local guidance you need to make your trip a memorable one (and to live like a local!). Let's start with the
host_about: Proud father of two young men and husband to a beautiful, amazing wife, I was born and raised in spectacular Bozeman, Montana a hometown that I cherish and brag about every day. My work is in the field of genetic diagnostics, a fulfilling career helping provide hope to rare and undiagnosed children. I travel regularly for work and personally with my family where our preference is alway Airbnb. :-)

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
description:
This cozy quiet room in Bozeman is a great home base for your adventures in Bozeman. It is comfortable and clean with a private bathroom. The room has a queen bed, small fridge, microwave and TV. With laundry room outside the room.

The space
There is a queen size bed, micro wave, small fridge with little freezer enough for treats. There is a coffee pot provided, two sets of plates bowls and utensils. There is a smart TV. We do not have cable but the TV comes with many Chanel’s and all the smart tv services such as Netflix, Amazon prime and other venues you can use with your codes.
There is a desk with two stools for a work area.
There is a washer drier just outside your door we provide laundry soap. There is a private bath supplied with linens, shampoo conditioner, bath wash and hand soap. The size of the room is depicted in the pictures provided.

Guest access
The guests will have access to their bedroom bathroom and the laundry
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is in the Gallatin Valley in Bozeman surrounded by the beautiful Bozeman mountains. There is a view from the front stoop of the beautiful Bridger mountains.  You are minutes from the mountains and downtown Bozeman.
host_about: We have been hosts for Airbnb for 7 years. When we travel we hope to have a comfortable and clean place to stay. We have worked hard to ensure you have the same experience.

host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Welcome to The Purple Palace in the heart of Downtown Bozeman! This location cannot be beat and offers walking distance to everything going on in town. Great shopping, tasty restaurants and in-town hiking/biking paths await. After exploring, come back to your palace to relax in front of the fire, take a hot shower and enjoy the peaceful backyard space. Two full bedrooms and an extra cot can accommodate up to five guests!

Other things to note
PLEASE NOTE:
We offer Verizon hotspot Wi-Fi, and do not have high speed Wi-Fi, but we are within walking distance to several cafes who do if you need to get some work done.

PET LIMIT: 2 DOGS ONLY, a $200 fee will be assessed for guests who bring more than 2 dogs.

Most homes in Bozeman are not equipped with air conditioning, including ours. We recommend keeping windows open!

name: Home in Bozeman · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 0 baths
description:
The space
Bozeman Bungalow at Beall

Nestled in the heart of the vibrant city of Bozeman, this charming bungalow grants guests easy access to Main Street, Montana State University, local museums, shops, and restaurants. Steps away, visit some local favorite coffee shops, bagel shops, and the Co-op. Also nearby you'll find some of the tastiest taco trucks!

Featuring the perfect blend of early-days-Montana and new Montana, this quaint, lovely home comes complete with beautiful stained glass windows, repurposed wood floors, and picturesque views of Bridger.

The living room, cozy and comfortable, is home to a soft sofa and a large TV, ideal for movie nights. The full kitchen makes cooking easy with its stainless steel appliances and ample meal prep space. Drenched in sunlight, this space is fun to cook in and even more fun to dine in! When you want to escalate your cooking, utilize the barbecue grill and host a sweet summer barbecue.

Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

name: Home in Bozeman · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
description:
Amazing 3 bedroom hideaway

The space
Spend your time in your new favorite home away from home. This amazing 3 bedroom home has absolutely everything you need to peacefully enjoy your time in Bozeman.
As soon as you open the door, you will fall in love with the “Scandinavian with hints of old Bozeman” atmosphere provided by the home on 15th Avenue. The owners have poured their hearts in to making this space a dream come true for gathering families.
The main floor checks all the boxes for everything you need to base your Bozeman adventures. Enjoy catching up with friends and family over coffee in the seating area in the front of the house.  At the end of the day, gather around the wood burning stove and Smart TV and enjoy too much wine.
The cook in your family will appreciate the large kitchen. The owners have provided a well-stocked kitchen to prepare meals for all. Plenty of cookware, small appliances and spices are included for your convenience.
host_about:
Dream MT Properties, formally "Cozy Creek", is proud to be a small rental agency that gives special attention to its owners as well as guests. When planning your next trip to the Big Sky area, you will deal with very few people who understand what it takes to make a vacation great for your group coming in.  We pride ourselves in have a properties that are clean, well stocked, and in a great location.

Not only are we a small company that delivers one on one customer service, we also love giving free advice on where to eat, hike, ski, fish, play and sight see while you are visiting.

description:
Welcome to your luxury home away from home. This brand-new condo is situated near the shoreline of Bozeman Pond. It's the perfect place for a family or a group: Each of the three bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom. The primary suite features a king size bed, private balcony, two-sided fireplace, and a soaking tub with mountain views. The great room boasts a chef's kitchen, a giant living room with a gas fireplace, and a second-story patio gazing out at the Bridger mountains.

The space
This brand-new condo is the first to be completed in a development that is still actively under construction. Construction is expected through the fall of 2023.

It is a three-story home with high-end finishes, original art, and environmentally-friendly cleaning products.

The home is three stories, offering expansive mountain views from every room.
On the first level, you'll find an attached garage, an entry with seating and storage, and a bedroom wi
neighborhood_overview:
Bridger Vale is a brand-new development on Bozeman's north side. So new, in fact, that it is still under construction. While our home is completely finished, there are other buildings adjacent to us that are still actively being built. As such, you can expect construction noises, crews, and a little extra mud from April until September 2023.

Beyond the construction, this neighborhood is home to "Bozeman Beach," also known as Glen Lake Rotary Park. This popular pond is bustling in the summer with swimmers, paddle-boarders, small watercraft, beach volleyball, and more. Across the pond or a short drive away, you'll find MAP Brewing and the other amenities available in this neighborhood.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

From the moment you step inside, you'll be immersed in a world of artistic inspiration and imagination. The interior of the rental is decorated with vibrant colors, intricate patterns, and unique furnishings that reflect the creativity and passion of artist/owners.

The space
Located in a vibrant and creative neighborhood just a few miles from Downtown Bozeman, this rental boasts a distinctive design that sets it apart from any other vacation rental you've ever seen.

The living space is open and airy, with plenty of natural light streaming in through large windows. Comfortable seating invites you to relax and unwind, while the fully equipped kitchen provides everything you need to prepare meals and snacks during your stay.

The bedroom is a sanctuary o
host_about:
Family. Friends. Mountains. Skiing. Real Estate. Photography. Big Adventures. 

Relationships are the most important thing in life, and time spent with friends and family is what I live for. The number of great friends that I met because of Airbnb is an ever-growing list that can no longer can be counted with just fingers and toes.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
description:
This downtown 3 Bedroom Casita has a unique style and is conveniently located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. Take in peaceful vibes from the surrounding nature and parks - all within a 5 minute walk to central downtown and a short drive to Bridger Bowl ski area, Hylite Canyon, the Madison River and many other outdoor recreation destinations. Cared for by 2 Super Hosts, you are sure to have the best stay possible!

The space
Our charming Casita is the lower unit of large home (built in 1932!) located in the beautiful, historic neighborhood of Cooper Park. This is a private space includes 3 bedrooms, a spacious living room with a pullout couch, a gas fireplace, a full kitchen with amenities, a full bathroom and a large, fenced-in backyard. Guests will have access to parking in the driveway as well as free street parking. There are delicious breakfast, lunch and coffee spots within a 2 minute walk, as well as a laundry mat. Beautifu
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in the Cooper Park Historic District, which includes Colonial Revival, Bungalow/craftsman, and Queen Anne architecture. The streets are lined with trees and cute bungalows, most of which are pre-war built.
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I love traveling, meeting new people and trying new things. I have been a host and guest on airbnb since 2010, and have had some amazing experiences. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

The space
This is a sunny, 1-bedroom, 1 bathroom historic home. The kitchen is fully stocked with pots and pans, dishes, silverware, and all the main kitchen gadgets.
