name: Home in Bozeman · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located home. Lots of space both inside and out. Lovely yard with fire pit, a front porch with rockers, and a breeze way for easy dry access to the kitchen or a great place to grill and hang out. Walk to campus and town from this convenient location.

3 bedrooms, two up and one down, 2 full baths w/towels etc, kitchen, dining-room and livingroom have loads of windows. Stone fireplace adds extra charm.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

Our backyard studio is located on Bozeman’s iconic Willson Avenue, in the perfect downtown location. This cozy spot is perfect for an overnight stop, on your way to Yellowstone or Glacier National Parks, or a longer stay to enjoy all that Bozeman has to offer.

Summertime is heaven in Montana and our quiet studio offers a queen sized bed, a simple, but well stocked kitchen, including complimentary Starbucks coffee and a single bathroom with shower. Everything you need for an easy Bozeman vacay!

The space
Single room studio, with queen sized bed, simply-stocked kitchen including fridge space, Kuerig coffee machine and 4 burner stove, plus 3/4 bath and stacking washer & dryer. All the basic comforts available to make your stop easy and enjoyable.

Parking is next to the garage an
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

neighborhood_overview: Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even a solo trip. Come and explore all tha

Looking for an affordable but central place to stay in Bozeman? Within 5 blocks, you can access Main Street restaurants & bars, Peet's Hill, Bogert Park, pickleball courts, a public pool, ice skating rink, Lindley Park, the library, kids' playgrounds, and more! This shared Airbnb-hostel style basement apartment offers a private room while sharing the kitchen, bathroom, and living room with two other private rooms. name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Cozy apartment located on the edge of Bozeman in quiet neighborhood with views of the Bridger Mountains. This house is recently renovated and is in one of the best areas of Bozeman -- We are just a few minutes from town but secluded enough to feel like the country. You'll have access to running/biking/ski trails from our back fence line, you're a quick walk to Peets Hill (off-leash dog park) and downtown is a 5 min drive/25 min walk away!

* PLEASE GET APPROVAL FIRST IF YOU ARE BRINGING A PET*

The space
Downstairs there is one bedroom with a queen size bed, a bathroom (shower, no tub), living room, and a full kitchen. The couch folds out to a queen size memory foam sleeper bed, so you can fit 4 people comfortably. The unit has a separate entrance from the main house, so you can come and go as you please with your own privacy. There is shared laundry with the main house as you enter through the side entrance (the separate entrance to the downstairs).
host_about: Outdoor Lover. Runner. Optimist. Travel Enthusiast. Leader. Documenter of silly antics. Procratiscooker. Idealist trying to improve earth.

description:
Gorgeous views of Mt Ellis + the Bridger's. House is situated on a quiet dead end street w trails.

This modern room + bathroom space is downstairs, not a separate apartment.

2 min to downtown/Main St. by car. Newer furniture, beds are warm+comfy with down comforters, quality bedding.

Longer stays more than 9 nights requires a security deposit

Sometimes our small dog Lilah @house.
About Lilah: guests love her. Lilah is typically very quiet-initially gets excited meeting new guests + friends.

The space
The two level house is peaceful and tranquil, right on beautiful trails great for biking, running, walking and even xc skiing some days on fresh snow, groomed trails + un groomed. It's on a dead end street a 3 minute drive and a 15-20 min walk from downtown, Main Street.

-Our neighborhood is affectionately called the “Tree Streets” where most of the trees are bigger than the homes.
host_about:
I’ve been enjoying the MAGICAL 
outdoors from the mountains to the ocean all of my life. 

Bozeman usually has beautiful weather, with too many summer activities to list from biking hiking kitesurfing you name it!…winter skiing both downhill + xc are some of the best in the world. The fishing is phenomenal, the people amazingly friendly + the town of Bozeman has so much to offer..Come play in the outdoors!  Happy to make some great suggestions!

The space
Picturesque views of Lindley Park (literally right out your window) and Bridger Mountain range from the balcony. Spacious, luxurious top-floor condo with own enclosed/heated garage for those snowy days.

Guest access
Entire condo is available for guest use. Upon request, guests are welcome to use the heated garage. Typically, guests park at the main entrance and take elevator to the third floor, which is the most convenient entry to condo. Long term and winter guests typically use garage which is accessible via internal hallway and exterior keypad.

City of Bozeman STR License: STR23-00028

Guest is responsible to pay 8 percent Sales and Use Tax

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.81 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Bright and airy studio apartment with all the amenities. This modern space
is designed with clever efficiency to provide a calming place to nestle in after work or play in Bozeman or the surrounding areas.

The space
The unit was renovated in the fall of 2018 and features quality stainless steel appliances, modern woodlike flooring, furniture, and cabinetry. While the space is approximately the size of a hotel room, the studio layout is efficient and features a full kitchen, work area/desk, lounge area, and private bathroom. The queen size murphy bed tucks away for extra space and the velvety soft couch is light enough for one person to easily move across the space to make room for the bed at night. Clothing space is hidden within cabinets and extra space for hanging items is available in the bathroom. The unit itself does not have any shared walls with the other units outside of the common entry/foyer space.

This unit has great walkability
neighborhood_overview: Nestled between the Montana State University campus and the greater downtown area,  this property creates a home base just blocks from both.   Little to no "through traffic" as the house sits on a dead end street in a quiet residential neighborhood.  Within walking distance to coffee shops and restaurants.  You haven't taken in historic MSU Bozeman until dining at Columbo's pizza and the original Pickle Barrel on the MSU campus, both a 10 minute walk. A beautiful 1 mile stroll through the historic residential district of Bozeman brings you to downtown Bozeman before you know it,  traversing the trails in beautiful Cooper Park along the way.
host_about:
I am a Montana native, born and raised in Bozeman. I love it here and I never get tired of the breath taking mountain views.  I have been managing my own real estate rentals for over 20 years and appraising real estate here in the Gallatin Valley since 2007.  I am also a real estate broker at Starner Commercial Real Estate in Bozeman Montana.

I like to travel to warm locations. My husband and I honeymooned in Thailand and I hope to visit again someday.   My hobbies include hiking, spending time with family and working on real estate deals.   I've enjoyed being an AirBnB host and all the great people I've met along the way!

name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
This beautifully renovated 1910 downtown home is the perfect spot for your Montana visit, adventure or staycation.

SoBo Cottage: #STR20-00293

Enjoy a spacious chefs kitchen with heated floors, a soothing queen bedroom w/vaulted ceiling & vanity sink, retro-tiled bathroom, living rm with gas fireplace, warm maple floors and comfy sofa-bed. 1 block south of Main , our landmark revolving horse, vibrant cafes, coffee-shops, boutiques and more are steps away! Includes parking spot.

The space
Newly-renovated 1900's house in premiere downtown location is the perfect home base for your Montana adventure or work stay-cation. Set just one block from Main Street's landmark revolving horse, Bozeman's vibrant cafes, coffee-shops, boutiques, and downtown events are mere steps away!

MSU is a short 10 minute walk away. One parking spot on left side of the driveway is reserved for SoBo Cottage guests, as well as free street parking.

Y
neighborhood_overview:
SoBo Cottage is located 1 block from the historic Revolving Horse on the corner of Main Street & South Bozeman Avenue. Dozens of restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, and bars are within walking distance with entertainment, nightlife and shopping minutes from the front door: Farmers Markets - The Emerson, Bogert Park, Fairgrounds; Festivals & Fairs- Sweet Pea, Slam Fest, Gallatin County Fair; Live Theater - The Ellen Theatre, Shakespeare in the Parks, Verge Theater, Bozeman Actors Theater; Live Music - The Rialto, The Ellen, The Elm; Indie Film - The Bozeman Film Society; Music on Main -Enjoy it from our front yard!; Art Walk & Christmas Stroll, plus much more make SoBo Cottage the perfect landing spot to experience Bozeman!

Montana State University is a short drive or a 10 minute walk to the South. The Post Office, Community Food Co-op, Ace Hardware are 1 block away. You simply can't find a place closer to the hub of downtown Bozeman!
host_about: Welcome and thanks for checking out SoBo Cottage! I'm a longtime Bozeman-ite, graduating from Bozeman High and Montana State University after spending my youth traveling the world with my family in the military. I live just a few blocks from SoBo Cottage and am excited to share my home and wonderful community with you!

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
The Bozeman Retreat is just seven blocks from downtown and only a few blocks from midtown Bozeman. This new highly efficient contemporary home features a full kitchen, local TV, Roku, WiFi, stereo with Bluetooth, keyless entry, washer, dryer, coffee maker, filtered water, in-floor heat, new appliances, and welcoming decor. Guests will sleep well on a medium-profile hybrid mattress combining the benefits of a traditional innerspring with a thick layer of cushioning memory foam. There is plenty of parking and the retreat is easy to get to and from wherever your travels might take you.

The space
The Bozeman Retreat is a separate unit of a new home completed in December of 2020. Plenty of natural light fills this warm space. Unique decor from around the globe, a fully stocked kitchen, and more make this clean, quiet space a good choice for travelers visiting Bozeman, Montana.

The yard space has been planted with natural and native flowers and grasses. Th
neighborhood_overview: The Bozeman Retreat is in the 'old' or original part of Bozeman. Homes in this area are a mix of original homes that were built in the 1930's to new homes like the Retreat. There is an elementary school a few blocks to the west. Downtown is five to seven blocks away. Bozeman's Midtown is five blocks away. The street is quiet with really not much more traffic than residential.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

The space
These rooms are half of the first floor of my 100 year old home and were completely renovated with your every comfort in mind. This space designed for 1-2 people that want to sleep in the same bed and has its own locked door. There is the wonderful, original slipper tub to take long, hot soaks in and I have been told that the bed is amazingly comfortable. If you need anything, all you need to do is text or call me and I will see about getting what you need. There is a sitting room, bathroom, and bedroom, Keurig coffee maker, microwave, small frig, toaster upon request, television, cable, and DVD player. There is not a kitchen sink or stove. Relax on the couch while you search the web or watch a movie (wifi, high speed internet, several movies to choose from, and 120 channels included). The south facing front porch is a perfect
neighborhood_overview:
I love that it is 2 blocks from the heart of downtown Bozeman where you will find a wonderful assortment of shops, restaurants, the city library, walking trails, and a park. A walking trail start just 1 block south that will take you by fields, wooded areas, creeks, and a duck pond. It is four blocks to the city library and one block to Bogert Park and the outdoor city pool. Being a native of this area, I will be able to help you match your preferences regarding restaurants, activities, etc. to the huge array of options.

Bozeman and the surrounding area has so much to offer: 1.5 hours to Yellowstone Park, unending hiking and cross country ski trails, two top notch downhill ski areas with a total of 24 lifts and 222 named runs, world class fishing, golfing, everything from amazing sushi to one of the best steaks you will ever eat, great little shops with unique items, amazing chocolates and caramels made locally, the best shoe store ever, majestic mountains all around a
host_about: I have lived in or near Bozeman all of my life.  I purchased this home several years ago and raised my three children here and now that they are off on their own adventures, I would love to share this home with you and all this amazing area has to offer.

host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

description:
The space
Little Cottage Lane Retreat

Framed by picturesque mountain views, this modern new-build home boasts prime access to all the best that Bozeman has to offer. Conveniently located just minutes from Bozeman Health and MSU, this three-bedroom home offers a convenient home base near downtown attractions and within easy reach of outdoor recreation. Enjoy al fresco dining on the covered patio equipped with a gas grill and table set for six or head out to the private, outdoor living room for sunshine or starlight gatherings while taking in views of the Bridger range.

The spacious, two-story interior showcases stylish modern design and high-end amenities furnished with guest comfort in mind. The well-appointed kitchen features a sleek black finish and a full suite of updated, stainless steel appliances - including a dishwasher - for home-cooking convenience. There's seating for four at the kitchen island and the adjacent dining table seats up to six.

host_about: Tess is my name and dancing is my game! I'm a Minnesota transplant who found her way to Montana for school and have stayed in the mountains ever since. When traveling, I'm either flanked by my fantastic husband, a group of amazing girlfriends or a handful of crazy family members. I like to relax, check out nightlife, shop and explore fun hot spots when I visit new places. Point me towards the best burger joint in town where I can enjoy live music and a local brew, and I'm a happy camper!

Next to the historic Baxter Hotel there is easy access to I-90.

The space
Come to majestic Montana and enjoy the ambiance and the hustle and bustle of historic downtown Bozeman. A one-of-a-kind 1000 sq ft plush renovated and meticulously decorated loft is located on the sunny, peaceful and quiet side of Main Street surrounded by Bozeman’s best restaurants, galleries, shops, breweries and entertainment. neighborhood_overview:
Take a Walk Down Main Street
Enjoy Historical Downtown Bozeman!
Be a local and walk from your new home in Historic Downtown Bozeman to the many sights, eateries and museums lining Main Street: Jam Eatery, Tree Line Coffee, Emerson Cultural Center, The Ellen Theater, Gallatin History Museum, Rialto Music Venue, Bozeman Food Co-op, Lululemon, Country Book Shelf, Schnees Shoes, Black Bird Kitchen, Theory Hair Salon, The Market Place, Backcountry Burger Bar and The Bozeman Public Library. Bozeman is where new vogue culture meets legendary history.
Take it all in by living in the heart of what John Bozeman found so intriguing years ago.



Ready for an Adventure?
Rent a bike from Owenhouse Cycling or walk from the Downtown Public Library on the Gallagator Trail south to The Museum of the Rockies and meet the local dinosaurs!
Next, tour around Montana State University to see what all the hype is about!

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Right in the hub of downtown Bozeman! Walk out the Baxter Hotel (Ted's Montana Grill) or the Cannery, through the parking lot and into your backyard!! This 1890's pink brick Victorian house has a quaint apartment on the back side. Perfect for walking downtown. Relax in the backyard enclosed by lilac bushes. Surrounded by businesses and downtown parking, however once you enter the white picket fence you feel the privacy the 12 foot lilac bushes offer. Min 30day (29 nights)

The space
This is a 1-bedroom studio suite with a full kitchen and full bathroom, original hardwood floors, claw-foot bathtub with shower, and porcelain gas stove. During recent renovation period wallpaper was uncovered on two of the walls and I decided to leave it. There is a kitchen table for two, Kuerig single cup coffee machine, microwave, toaster, fridge, bustle couch, and vanity. For your use there are local hiking, biking, and sightseeing books along with TWO bicycles.

Apartm
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is part of the historic overlay district and is a mix of residential and business with lots of turn of the century homes and mature trees.  Take a stroll in any direction and enjoy the architecture.
host_about:
Welcome to my home!  I love this fun town and am happy to share it with you.

I grew up in the military; moving around, traveling to amazing places, and forming life-long relationships with amazing people.  Now that I no longer move around, having my homes in Airbnb is a great way to have new people come my way!

I live in Bozeman, MT and take advantage of all there is to offer. Love finding the hidden treasures in this state.  I have rental homes in Bozeman and Livingston, MT and Sun Valley (Ketchum), ID.  They are all in the downtown areas, all in wonderful little towns.  Someday, I may find myself beep bopping from one to the other.

I currently sell real estate in Montana, so if you come this way and fall in love, like everyone does... you know who to call!

If you do stay at one of my homes, I do hope you enjoy it.  

Kathi

Bridger Bowl Ski resort is about 30 minutes away, Big Sky is about an hour, and Yellowstone is 90 minutes to the West Entrance and North Entrance.

The space
This is a tri-plex with a whole condo apartment for each floor. This unit is the top floor. Two of the bedrooms share a full bathroom which is nice because it's like there's two master bedrooms. The third bedroom can use the full bathroom that is also accessed from the living area. There is not a dining table, the eating area is at the countertop island in the kitchen. There are stairs to get up to the third floor. The layout of the apartment is very nice and it is an efficient use of space.

Guest access

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Beautiful condo with easy access to all Bozeman has to offer. Walkable to downtown, enjoy restaurants, bars, shops & nightlife. MSU is a mile away, Bridger Bowl is a 30 minute drive, Big Sky is about an hour away. Ski, hike, blue ribbon fly fishing, white-water rafting, mountain climbing, biking & hot springs are all near by. Walk to Bozeman's Co-op for organic groceries and Maven's Market for a great selection of gourmet delights. Visit Museum of the Rockies, American Computer & Robotics Museum

The space
Our unit sleeps 5 with a king sized bed in the main bedroom and a queen sized bed in the flex space. Living room has a sofa sleeper. Bathroom has a large walk-in shower, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion and a hair dryer.. The kitchen is well stocked with all that you need to prepare and enjoy home cooked meals, including spices and oils. Counter top bar has 4 stools. We have a coffee maker with complimentary coffee, a Nespresso Vertuo coffee machine inclu
neighborhood_overview: Just a block off Main Street, walkable to Bozeman's vibrant downtown offering shopping, dining, coffee shops, breweries and local nightlife. About 1 mile from Montana State University. The Food Co-op is an easy walk for all of your grocery items. Maven's Market is just across the street and features a huge selection of cheeses, gourmet items, a wine bar and a deli with breakfast, lunch, coffee and gelato.
host_about: I have lived in Bozeman for 28 years with my husband Warren. We love everything Montana has to offer.  We also like to camp and travel the country.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.73 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Originally built in the early 20th century, this historical home has been newly remodeled to fit your needs as you visit Bozeman. Located within walking distance of downtown Bozeman, the Midtown District, and the MSU campus, this home offers a relaxing and accommodating space to recharge as you explore all that Montana has to offer. The west entrance of Yellowstone National Park is open and accessable by way of a scenic 1 hour 45-minute drive through the mountains of Big Sky.

The space
Floor level unit of a historical duplex with quiet neighbors upstairs. The full space is yours to enjoy during your stay with two bedrooms, one bathroom and a fully functioning kitchen. Lots of windows for great natural light.

Guest access
The full floor level unit, the front yard, and the paved patio behind the home are available to our guests.

Other things to note
The home is shared with a neighbor who lives above this unit.
neighborhood_overview:
Right on Main Street this is a centrally located property that is backed by family friendly neighborhood great for strolling and seeing historical Bozeman. Multiple local ice cream shops both within a block of the property. Straight shot to downtown shopping.

Please note that there are tenants who live above the unit.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
The space
Grand Avenue Retreat

You couldn’t ask for a better location in Bozeman than this one-bedroom, ground-floor duplex, right downtown and within walking distance of shops, restaurants, breweries, cafés, and other attractions. Hiking, mountain biking, and golf are all nearby in the warm months, and it’s 17 miles to Bridger Bowl Ski Area in the winter.

At home, you’ll find a mountain-modern interior with hardwood floors and a cozy gas fireplace, perfect for chilly evenings. The full, modern kitchen offers everything you need to cook up a meal or just snacks for the trail. Grab a bite together at the table for two before heading out to explore. At the end of a fun day, grab a spot on the couch and stream the latest release. The next perfect Bozeman day awaits tomorrow - all that’s left to do is book.

THINGS TO KNOW
Streaming services are available with guest accounts.
This property is managed by Terah M. Young of
host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

name: Guesthouse in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Experience downtown Bozeman, Montana at this centrally-located executive suite. This fully furnished studio suite is perfect for the business traveler. Walking distance to restaurants, the post office, banks, shopping, coffee shops, and more. Fully furnished with a well stocked kitchen, washer/dryer, dedicated workspace, lounge area and a comfortable bed. You'll feel relaxed and refreshed after a great nights sleep at The Executive.

The space
The Executive studio is a single level building with a quaint patio located downtown Bozeman. It is the perfect location to stay for extended business trips.

Guest access
Full studio
neighborhood_overview:
South of Main Street filled with some of Bozeman’s most historic residences. Quiet streets lined with mature trees and towering Victorian-era homes distinguish this neighborhood. Residences are generally on smaller lots, with many having multiple units and shared back alley access. The Gallagator Linear Trail meanders throughout, connecting neighbors from Main Street to Kagy.

Great for those that want to stay in historic “old Bozeman” and be within walking distance from farmer’s markets and downtown events.

1-4 minutes to downtown

description:
Newly-remodeled 2 BR/2BA gem, located in Bozeman's historic district, a 6 min walk from downtown and an 8 min walk to Wild Crumb Bakery, Treeline Coffee, and Mountains Walking Brewery.

Highly flexible space gives options for anywhere from 1 to 4 guests to spread out. Great space to relax after a day at Bridger or Big Sky. Loft bedroom also functions well as a workspace.

High speed wifi. Free onsite parking. Air conditioning.

Approved Short Term Rental Registration #: STR22-00058

The space
Flexible 3 levels gives two traveling friends or two couples some space:

+ Ground level: master bathroom, brand new bathroom, W/D
+ Main level (middle floor): brand-new kitchen, brand-new bathroom, W/D, living rm.
+ Loft level (3rd floor): bedroom or office

Guest access
This 2 BR/2 BA space is the back half of a duplex. Guests have their own private entrance and their own free onsite parking.

description:
Enjoy the good life at this peaceful and centrally-located home close to all Bozeman offers.

This condo is half of a duplex featuring a private backyard and patio, fully stocked kitchen and extra office with dedicated desk space.

The space
Enjoy the comfortable guest bedroom, stocked kitchen, full bath and living space. We have a dedicated workspace in the office area, as well as seating in the outdoor spaces.

Guest access
Everything except the owner's suite and garage are available for guests.

Other things to note
The owner and Cohost Catherine is from France and enjoys hosting other travelers when she is away from Bozeman. She is an avid nature lover and photographer, you'll see some of her work in the house!

I also enjoy helping hosts create and manage wonderful spaces for guests on Airbnb.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Note: 30 day minimum rentals only.
Welcome to my quaint and comfortable two bedroom Bozeman cottage! Walking distance to Main Street - enjoy restaurants, parks, nearby skiing and rivers, and unwind with a drink on the deck.

The space
The main floor of my North Side Bozeman home features 1050 sq. ft. of living space with an open concept living and dining area. Cozy up to the gas fired stove in winter after a day of skiing at Big Sky or Bridger Bowl. The living room has a smart TV. A bright well lighted chef's kitchen and breakfast bar provides an inviting atmosphere for guests to prepare and share meals. There are two bedrooms, each with a queen sized bed and ample closet space. There is one large bathroom central to both bedrooms with two matching porcelain sinks. Relaxation is in order in the extra deep 60" jetted, heated soaker tub/shower combination. Unwind from the day with a drink on the large deck, which is appointed with comfortable furnishings for fa
neighborhood_overview: Great location! Only a few blocks walking distance to Main Street. I'd be happy to give you restaurant, bar and cafe recommendations. Bridger Bowl ski resort is 15 miles up the road, and Big Sky ski resort is about an hour away. Lots of hiking, biking and rivers to enjoy around Bozeman. The north entrance to Yellowstone National Park is around 1 1/2 hours away.
host_about: Avid cyclist, horse rider and skier. Favorite travel destinations: Costa Rica, Scandinavia, France, Italy, and the Rocky Mountains.

description:
Centrally located to all Bozeman has to offer.

The space
Wether you’re coming to Bozeman to enjoy the world class skiing, hiking or fishing or here to stroll through the lively shops and restaurants down town, this property is centrally located to enjoy all that “Big Sky Country” has to offer. Just minutes from downtown Bozeman and a scenic 1.5 hour drive to either the north or west entrances of Yellowstone National Park. Enjoy a cup of coffee on the balcony as you take in the scenic views of the Bridger Mountains and the famous “M Trail”. In the winter months cozy up to the gas fireplace and enjoy a glass of wine while streaming your favorite movie on the flat screen TV. Guests will find all they need to make this their home away from home.

Our fully furnished, contemporary style condo has 3 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms. Guests will enjoy a third floor master bedroom with a king size bed and on-suite bathroom. Second bedroom with one queen bed. Addi

Mike and Jessi spend part of the year at their home in Bozeman Montana and part  of the year in Sunapee New Hampshire.  They’ve been hosting guests in Sunapee since 2020 and have just recently added their Bozeman property to their short term rentals. They welcome you at either property.

description:
Clean, bright, sunny, historic home with original wood work in living area. Private, fenced backyard with grill, firepit, trampoline, sandbox with toys and a pet bunny for kids to play with. Bikes available upon request. Playroom with toys. Perfect for families or small groups. King bed in the master, queen bed in the downstairs bedroom and a trundle bed in other bedroom. Office/studio off master. 4 blocks from MSU and close to downtown.

The space
Our home was built in 1916 and has original wood work in the main living area. Hardwood floors on the main level with carpeted bedrooms. The office has a great view to the street. There is a playroom with toys. The south facing window seat is a warm place on a sunny day. The backyard is fenced so kids can run. There is a trampoline and a sandbox as well. We even have a bunny the kids can play with. There is a church next door which is a VERY quiet neighbor.

Guest access
There is a downst
neighborhood_overview: Cooper Park is 1/4 block away.  Walk to restuarants, stores and coffee shops near MSU. Walk to events at MSU.  Main Street is 5 blocks away.  Southside Park has a playground and is 4 blocks away.  Irving School is one block away and has a playground that is accessible on the weekends.
host_about: I am Dad to 2 great kids, a runner, business owner and traveler.  I currently am living in Stuttgart, Germany with my family. My wife is working for USAID and I am an at home Dad and CEO of my landscaping business in Bozeman.  We use Airbnb frequently in our travels around the world and have stayed in some amazing places.  I have traveled extensively in Europe and Asia, run a 100K race in Nepal and spent a month in South Africa in the last few years.  I enjoy reading, learning languages and cultures and seeing new things.  My family is my world and we mostly travel together.  I like to travel off the beaten path.  I'd rather get inside a place for a few days or a week than get the photos and videos in a few hours.  I am constantly learning and improving myself and I love the flexibility and freedom I have.

neighborhood_overview:
Throughout the year, Bozeman is alive with activity. With festivals and outdoor concerts during the summer and endless outdoor summer and winter activities.

Enjoy the nearby hot springs, ski hills, trails, music events or the bustling downtown and get ready to explore! With downtown Bozeman minutes away (walking or driving), you are in the epicenter of Bozeman’s charm and can enjoy this booming little town and all it has to offer.

If you are looking to extend your adventures, you are just a short trip in any direction to the following:

21 min to Bridger Bowl Ski Mountain
90 min to Yellowstone National Park (Entrance)
25 min to Livingston
50 min to Big Sky
15 min to Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport

description:
Welcome to Your Bozeman basecamp! Whether your outdoor adventure is hiking, skiing, or fishing, everything is within reach; including Big Sky Resort and Yellowstone National Park. Here for business, you found the perfect place. Our beautiful and efficient condo is a 15 minute drive from Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport, 60 minutes from Big Sky, 20 minutes from Bridger Bowl and steps away from Montana State University, great local shops, restaurants and grocery stores.

The space
Bozeman 303 is a brand new, beautifully decorated and comfortable space. Enjoy a cup of local coffee or cook a delicious meal in our well equipped, gourmet kitchen; watch a great movie or curl up with a good book in our comfortable living room; get some work done or enjoy a great meal in our multipurpose dining space, sip a cold beer on our inviting balcony and end your day with a great night's sleep in our cozy bed with 400 count organic cotton sheets and memory foam mattress
neighborhood_overview: Nestled into one of Bozeman's iconic craftsman style neighborhoods from the early 1900's and just two blocks from both it's historic downtown and local food markets, Bozeman 303 is the perfect location. Hiking trails, world class skiing, natural hot springs and Yellowstone National Park are all just a short drive away.  Bozeman offers a wide variety of dining and shopping experiences. Whether you enjoy upscale or casual dining, a local microbrew from one of our 12 breweries or a hand crafted cocktail, downtown Bozeman has exactly what you are looking for. Seeking local art, antiques or books? How about gear for your next adventure? The shopping scene in Bozeman does not disappoint.

neighborhood_overview: North Bozeman
host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

description:
In order to truly experience Bozeman and the abundance of attractions that make Montana "the most livable place", we would love for you to visit and even stay a while! Welcome to The Cottage: a luxury free standing condo offering both nightly and 30+ day stays, just minutes from downtown Bozeman with shopping and nightlife.

The Cottage was built with opulence, functionalism and attention to detail at the core of every design decision. A home away from home, the Lux Cottage is waiting for you.

The space
Bozeman City Hosting Permit #STR23-00046

The Cottage was recently purchased in 2022 by owners who are passionate about Montana, the outdoors, and all that Bozeman and the surrounding area has to offer. The condo is fully furnished with modern furniture and is stylishly designed for ultimate comfort with aesthetic brilliance.

The condo is designed for shorter visits and ideal for 30+ day stays, not to be confused with a month to mo
host_about:
Howdy! Welcome to Montana. I was born and raised on a working horse ranch in the heart of Paradise Valley, specifically Tom Miner Basin along the banks of the Yellowstone River. My parents continue to thrive on the ranch while my siblings and I went out into the world to pursue educations and other interests. My love for Montana brought me home in 2012, when I launched my vacation rental management business- MonTanya Yellowstone Properties & Concierge.

I'm based in Livingston and look forward to welcoming and accommodating you in southwest Montana.

The space

neighborhood_overview: North Bozeman
host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Unwind in the sizable comforts of this small modern space.

The space
ADU208 accommodates two guests in this immaculate, contemporary designed Accessory Dwelling Unit. The custom staircase leads up to the well-appointed queen bedroom. If you must work away from home a built-in desk may aid your efforts.

Rise, envelop yourself in the softness of a guest robe, and relax with a morning cup of Joe - take your pick of coffeemakers: pour-over, automatic drip, or pod. We stock local medium roast fresh ground. Or pull out the blender for those of you who like to whip up your start to the day!

Guest access
High-end appliances await your culinary skills but be forewarned - the best of Bozeman, from bakeries to breweries are just a short stroll away. Located in the ever-popular NE neighborhood, you will want to leave the peace and privacy of the ADU and walk the six short blocks to the heart of Main Street.

Other things to note
neighborhood_overview: ADU208 is five blocks from the center of downtown Bozeman. It is four blocks from the heart of Bozeman's Northeast Neighborhood.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
This studio apartment is located 3 blocks north of historic downtown Bozeman. Private free parking, private patio with chiminea, separate entrance, lush flower gardens, nearby shopping, pubs, restaurants, Willson Theatre and community parks. MSU is 1.5 miles from our home.

The space
We just recently remodeled and updated our vacation rental. We hope you find it to be quaint and cozy. We love living in historic downtown Bozeman and enjoy sharing this rare gem with our guests.

Guest access
The studio apartment is located behind the main house with its own private entrance. A parking space is reserved off the alley for our guests, just steps from your entrance.

Other things to note
This is a studio apartment. Most comfortable for a single person or couple. There is one queen bed with no door separating the queen bed from the living area. Sheer curtains have been hung for some privacy.
neighborhood_overview: This is in a neighborhood on the North side of downtown, eclectic and up and coming.  We also have a business license which ensures our guests that they can book with us and know it is secure and in accordance with our city provisions regarding Airbnb rentals.
host_about:
I moved to Bozeman over 30 years ago to attend college at MSU, and decided this was my home.  I am a self-employed property manager with properties in both Bozeman and Big Sky ski community.  My husband, Brian, is a lawyer and a native to Montana and the Bozeman area. We both love the outdoors including; hiking, fishing, skiing, snow shoeing, rafting, kayaking, biking golfing and playing tennis.  
We love to travel, some of our most recent trips include; Australia, Italy, Belize and Costa Rica. We love staying at other Airbnbs when we travel, all part of the fun.
We frequent the many wonderful restaurants and pubs downtown, Bozeman, and enjoy all the arts and performances that Bozeman has to offer.

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.85 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
This is a beautiful native American inspired decorated space. Private view looking out at the Bridger mountains! Peaceful and quiet, play bocci ball, badminton or corn hole in backyard. Home is cool all summer. We are within walking distance of the Cherry river fishing access and Bozeman beach.. We are a minute from town but secluded enough to feel like the country. A birders paradise. Close to Hot springs ! Awesome

The space
The space is cool and comfortable. Secluded and great views of the Bridger Mts. It faces north so the patio is cool and shaded. Enjoy the hanging chairs, glider or hammock. Watch the birds. There are several birdhouses on the property with occupied varieties of birds. Bear and moose frequent our land . We also have bocci ball, badminton, and corn hole games for the yard and many indoor games in the pantry in kitchen.We also have a barbecue and picnic table for outside cooking and dining.

Guest access
Space includes
neighborhood_overview: This is a secluded private country place , but on the edge of town and close to everything. It is a birders paradise being a flight path to the cherry creek ponds at the end of the road. While secluded we do have neighbors, although not visible. We ask that there are no loud parties.Fun and noise are fine just nothing over the top past 11 pm. And no fireworks .

name: Home in Bozeman · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Modern meets rustic, this brand new 4Q2019 home features one bedroom and one bathroom with all of the amenities to keep you comfortable during your stay in Montana. Whether you're here to watch a Cat Griz game, visit friends at Montana State University, or go climbing/skiing/hiking at Big Sky or Bridger, our centrally located home is the ideal spot in Bozeman. Reach out with any questions.

The space
DEDICATED ATTACHED GARAGE. Hard to beat Montana winter amenity that's rare for a 1-bedroom AirBnB. Step out to explore Bozeman from the comfort of a warm car. We're a 5 minute drive to the Montana State University campus or a 28 minute walk. Unlike many Bozeman-area listings on AirBnb, we have gotten the formal approval from the city including a fire inspection and accommodations license. Always verify listings before booking. ***Bozeman Short Term Rental License BCA-97039***

Guest access
Entire 1-bedroom cottage. Access to the space is provided
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is part of a Bozeman neighborhood with a family feel and panoramic views of mountains while being close to the convenience of city living. You'll quickly see why Montana has the nickname of the Big Sky state.
host_about: Born and raised in Helena, Montana I spent the majority of my life in the big sky state before heading off to college. My sister and brother and their families all are in Bozeman and my parents too. Montana is family and we can't wait to welcome you into ours.

name: Townhouse in Bozeman · ★4.87 · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
Unwind by a sleek gas fireplace after an active day in big sky country. Timber floors and framed images of nature are reminders of the rustic location of this contemporary townhouse. Cook in a chef's kitchen and let kids sleep in a room of bunk beds.

Master bedroom is on the main floor with two additional bedrooms and a loft upstairs.

Guests are allowed to use all spaces of the home except the garage as it’s used as storage. Please, make yourself at home.

The space
Come stay in our brand new townhome just 1.5 miles from Montana State University. host_about:
Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and how important it is to create memories that last a lifetime. Our Concierge and Reservations Team will be pleased to help you plan an amazing trip to Montana! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, let us be your one stop for vacation planning!

Check-in instructions are emailed 7 days prior to arrival with driving directions to the property. All of our properties are 24 hour self check-in, with a digital property guide emailed 2 days prior to check in and a QR code available in the home serving as a guest book with helpful information you made need during your stay, recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. Our Property Manager is available to assist you 7 days a week, 9am-10pm. Outside of normal business hours, we have an after hour call service to assist you. 

Stay Montana has enhanced protocols of our already highest standards for cleanliness:
*Cleaning products (CDC approved) applied with microfiber cloths
*Sheets and Towels are laundered by a commercial laundry facility (not in the home)
*Professionally trained cleaning staff using personal protective equipment
*Disinfection of high touch areas using a pressurized sprayer (or electrostatic sprayer) – counters, light switches, remotes, door handles
*Private Hot Tubs are drained, sanitized, & refilled before each new arrival
*Individually packaged, eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Your Montana Starts Here!

The space
Fully renovated 6 bedroom, 6.5 bathroom historic home, formerly a bed and breakfast, now available as a weekly rental packed with amenities. Great yard, off-street parking, back yard, and deck. The house comes with an on-site caretaker, the owners' son who lives in a completely separate basement apartment with its own entrance. We price our large capacity house based on the number of people in your party so the cost is kept low for smaller groups. The rate calculator will automatically adjust the cost by $20/person per night if your group size is larger than the base occupancy rate. In the high season the base occupancy is 10 people, at other times of the year is varies to as low as 6 people.

Beautifully renovated and ideally located, this spacious, light-fi
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

Cared for by 2 Airbnb Super Hosts, you are sure to have the best stay possible. This super unit offers 2 complete units in one!

The space
Welcome to our historic two-story home located in Cooper Park neighborhood and the heart of downtown Bozeman!

Our home is unique in that it can exit as one large house, or it can convert into a two-unit home with a floor level and downstairs basement, making this house perfect for a large group of friends or large families. There is an interior staircase that connects the bottom unit to the top unit. The stairwell can be closed off by a door for privac
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I love traveling, meeting new people and trying new things. I have been a host and guest on airbnb since 2010, and have had some amazing experiences. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: Rental unit in Bozeman · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Enjoy all the benefits of home in our comfortable and clean private apartment. Located centrally between Big Sky and Bridger Bowl Ski Areas and situated in the quiet and beautiful neighborhood, Valley West. A quick walk or bike ride will get you to nearby eateries. Just steps out the door are walking and biking trails around a lake. Air conditioning and eight large windows will keep you comfortable after a day on the trails and radiant floor heat will keep you warm and cozy after the slopes.

The space
The apartment has a fully equipped kitchen, a Ninja Hot and Cold Brew Coffee and Tea system for your convenience. The attached private bedroom has a very cozy queen bed with a large closet and dresser. Rest assured knowing there is a washer and dryer to keep your travels light and clean. The living area has books, games, and access to a full cable package. The TV is also equipped with a Roku for you to stream your apps with your own log in credentials. We pay v
neighborhood_overview:
We are located on the west end of Bozeman, near the entrance to Gallitan Canyon. Our street, Alexander, is one block off of Babcock St. A five minute walk to the south will get you to the Market at Ferguson Farms. This a development that has restaurants like, Sidewinders, Tanglewood, Nordic Brew Works and Hachi Sushi Pub. Foxtrot Cafe is located in the middle of the market and it anchors all these stores with an open air feeling and tons of lounge seating and tables. There are also a few boutiques, a reptile store and a grocery store being built as of summer 2023. We also love the Well Juicery, a cold pressed organic juice bar if you’re feeling healthy, or a really nice liquor store and cozy bar called Single Barrel if you’re feeling more spicy!
45 minute drive to Big Sky Resort, 1.5 hours to both the West and North entrance to Yellowstone National Park. Bridger Bowl, 30 minutes.
A quick drive over the pass to Livingston will get you to hotsprings, we love Chico Hotsprings
host_about: My husband, Tucker and I are Bozeman, MT locals. We love living here near family and friends and raising our two children in this beautiful country. Between the four of us we hike, bike, ski and snowboard and have many recommendations for your stay if needed.

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
This newly-built condo is exactly where you want to stay to get the full Bozeman experience! A short walk away from Main Street's highly rated restaurants and eclectic local shops. Close to Montana State University, making it easy to hop on a tour or explore the campus yourself. If you’re wanting to explore the Big Sky Country, this condo is a short drive from the outdoors and a has all the comforts of home when you’re ready to relax. Also, a perfect setup to work remotely.

The space
This is a one bedroom condo with a flex room. A queen size bed w/ nightstand is located in the flex room (open to the living room/kitchen area). The bedroom is setup to be a home office with a sofa that converts into another queen sized bed. The living room couch has a pull out sofa with a third queen sized bed. The modern kitchen comes fully stocked with all you need to cook and the balcony features a grill and a small table. The modern bathroom has a large walk in shower. The condo
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Bozeman is home to hundreds of thriving retailers, restaurants, and professional services. Bozeman and the entire greater Yellowstone region have so much to offer visitors. The quality of experiences enjoyed in Bozeman is largely determined by its amazing mountain setting which provides endless outdoor recreation opportunities. From skiing in the winter to fishing and hiking in the summer, Bozeman is a fabulous basecamp for exploring all that Southwest Montana has to offer. For being a small mountain town, Bozeman has a surprisingly impressive culinary scene. No matter what budget you're on or how picky you are, there are options for everyone, and the variety is growing by the day. Bozeman has every tasty bite you can imagine, from southern fried chicken to Korean bibimbap; from wood-fired pizza to fresh poke burritos. Bozeman is very fortunate to have a thriving arts and culture community. Highlights include our new “green” public library and the world-renowned Museum of the
host_about:
I am a working professional who works from home. I live in Bozeman, Montana for part of the year and rent my condo there out and travel frequently. 
I love living in Bozeman because of the natural beauty of Montana and the variety of outdoor activities that can be done year round with few crowds. Also, Bozeman has a friendly small mountain town feel with city conveniences including access to great restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. I am originally from Chicago and enjoy skiing, hiking, and riding a crossover motorcycle.

Bozeman Hosting permit #313210

The space
Park your car and walk everywhere! The home is located at at the top of historic Lindley Street. The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you might need to cook a cozy meal at home. Or if you'd rather go out, the house is located walking distance to all my favorite downtown restaurants and shops. name: Guest suite in Bozeman · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
This charming second story studio sanctuary is full of light and warmth with picture windows, a breakfast nook, a lovely patio and outdoor grill just below. Comfortable queen bed ( as well as a good full airbed with a set of sheets if needed additionally). Great location! with easy access to downtown within a few blocks and immediate access to roads leading to wilderness, skiing and hiking. Treehouse in summer, cozy nest in winter.

The space
The Colburn House is included in the National Registry of Historic Places. The old garage was converted into a carriage house apartment in 1991 and the studio ( one large well proportioned room) is located on the second story
( wide, easy staircase) a composition of wood floors, wool oriental carpets, an airy ceiling, and original art. Cozy, clean, authentically warm, we invite you to enjoy this space while you take advantage of the area's great outdoor recreation. You will have access to a coffee/tea (local, organic) m
neighborhood_overview:
A friendly neighborhood on a quiet street lined with mature trees just 5 blocks from historic downtown Bozeman. You will get a true taste of local life in our quaint and lively Big Sky town. The neighbors are friendly, down to earth, cooperative, and caring. We are just 5 minutes away from the Community Food Co-op in operation since 1971, a variety of coffee shops, bakeries, and restaurants, just another few blocks towards downtown. We also have easy access to outbound highways which will quickly take you to our beautiful mountains and rivers where you will find some of the world's best hiking, fly fishing and skiing in every direction. For the art enthusiast, we have a well established art community, the hub of which is located within easy walking distance at the Emerson Cultural Center. The Montana State University campus is a few minutes drive and a twenty minute walk south.

The larger neighborhood: The studio is centrally located to major ski areas such as Bridger Bowl
host_about: Hello, I am a fourth generation Montana Native, born in Bozeman. I am a visual artist/photographer and wilderness lover. My father was a fishing guide and renowned naturalist in this area so I can show you some out of the way places that won't appear in your guidebooks, as well as some of the tucked away local hangs. Montana is known for her friendly folks. We fit the bill here at the Colburn House.  Let us host you Montana style! Lively, friendly and spacious.

name: Home in Bozeman · ★4.50 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
description:
2 Bedroom Condo in North Bozeman

The space
Nestle into the Gallatin Getaway for stays longer than 7 nights. 
This condo is in an ideal location for accessing all that Bozeman has to offer. Located off of north 19th Ave, you can be anywhere in town in under 10 minutes. 
Open the door to an inviting living space. The living room is furnished with very comfortable furniture to help you relax after a long day. The TV is equipped with cable. 
The well stocked kitchen has everything you need to prepare family meals. 
Upstairs, you will find 2 comfortable rooms. Each bed is a queen size with cozy bedding. 
Also upstairs is the full bathroom with 2 separate sink areas. Washer and dryer provided for you to use.
host_about:
Dream MT Properties, formally "Cozy Creek", is proud to be a small rental agency that gives special attention to its owners as well as guests. When planning your next trip to the Big Sky area, you will deal with very few people who understand what it takes to make a vacation great for your group coming in.  We pride ourselves in have a properties that are clean, well stocked, and in a great location.

Not only are we a small company that delivers one on one customer service, we also love giving free advice on where to eat, hike, ski, fish, play and sight see while you are visiting.

name: Condo in Bozeman · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
description:
Cannery South - Sunny Two Bedroom Condo in Cannery Flats

The space
Brand new in 2021!

BRIEF DESCRIPTION: Cannery South is a brand new condo on Bozeman's northeast side, right in the midst of excellent bars/restaurants and within miles of downtown. This unit has the best location in the building- facing south on the fourth floor- with incredible mountain views and lots of sunshine. Floor-to-ceiling windows connect you with the views and, on top of that, you have a private balcony. Enjoy modern finishes with access to building amenities like the rooftop!

GENERAL LOCATION AND SETTING: This unit is in Cannery Flats, a brand new build in Bozeman's up-and-coming Cannery District. Pizza, sushi, coffee, and more are right next door, along with a gym and barber shop. Downtown is just minutes away to the south and MAP Brewing is minutes away to the north.
